tXgTIVxpyZIs768l3jAc3g.text: Been here almost a dozen times. Good service. Open later than a lot of Phoenix restaurants.  Never crowded or noisy.  We are always trying something different and have never been unsatisfied.  Every dish is full of  intense flavor.  A must try!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States

z5HNj_ZQCHFxHVUpDIiLUw.text: Delicious food, not too spicy, lovely decor, pleasant service. I've been here many times. Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our table today. I love this place!

XEYw7mFC6InoPjwPFe5Okg.text: Don't go. If there was a no star option, I would have chosen that. Awful buffet. Cold, stale food. Bad service. Never ever going back.

f64Tvm9vEvb75BXw5mb2fw.text: Great lunch buffet for a good price. If you want good, all you can eat Indian food for a cheap price, you should check this place out. It's not the best Indian food in the area, but it's still pretty tasty. Service was also excellent and my wife and I enjoyed the ambiance. I can't vouch for their dinners or for their take-out, which appear to gather the lower reviews, but I can speak for their lunch buffet. It's worth a try!

JtLoD5HPKHrGlBS_k4nLKQ.text: By far my favorite food and place to eat in all of Phoenix, possibly AZ.  The food is beyond amazing and so full of wonderful flavors!!!  I always go during the buffet so I don't have to pick one thing, I can have it all! The employees are friendly, the place is clean and the price is very fair!!! I have to force myself not to go too often so that each time (once a month) is always exciting and like a celebration!  Oh you have to go!!! Hurry!!!!  You will be so glad you did!

7l5_StQkBqtqw3NClBYFzg.text: Was passing through town and had a craving for Indian food. This place had a Nice atmosphere, food was good and ample portions. I'll be back on my next trip.

Ck9u2D7sp3YoAljp_ngVqg.text: Food is still good, but their service is pretty bad.  Our waiter kept on making bad faces at us ever since my friend ordered something to go and the waiter thought she wanted it in addition to her buffet ( weird right?) Then the manager and waiter tried to hurry us out and made us pay when we were still eating and when the place wasn't full. It was very rude!  I don't know if they changed managers, but you can tell it was no longer a happy and friendly place at this restaurant based on all the worker's faces.

v-0aHoVzzJ_LpAjzOosMrw.text: For those who have come here and ordered anything lower than 7 on the spiciness scale, you shouldn't be eating Indian food in the first place. The Chinese buffet is down the road.   That aside, my boyfriend and I have been here twice and have been blown away both times. We order the samosas, lamb vindaloo, chicken tiki masala, a veggie dish I can't remember the name of, garlic naan, and basmati. The first time we ordered a spice level of 8 and the second time 9. I'd prefer somewhere in between.   The food makes it to the table quickly and is full of flavor. The two times we've been there for dinner, the service has been friendly and attentive, so I'm confused by the yelpers who bag on the wait staff.  We spent about 50 dollars on a ton of food (half is in the fridge to be enjoyed tomorrow as well) and it's always worth it.   There's also a small market with a wide selection of authentic spices, marinades, chutneys and other ingredients so you can attempt to cook Indian at home.  We crave this restaurant constantly and would recommend it to anyone who thinks they know good Indian food!

uqNTbMNpciTHcy-WJYOZOw.text: So I have been to this place many times before and I have never been unhappy, but today was a different story... THEY PUT GREEN AND RED BELL PEPPERS IN THE INDIAN FOOD! I couldn't believe it. I love spices and Indian food has a lot of them and they are very tasty, but bell peppers make me nauseous and give me indigestion. They few things that didn't have peppers, like their spinach dish, were oily and not really creamy like they should be. Overall- inauthentic and disappointing. I've never been so full yet so dissatisfied. I told the shift supervisor so hopefully they will fix the bell pepper issue, until then my advise is to go somewhere else. It's not worth the $30 bill.

bfXZXKf-xvjyhjy9IqSavQ.text: They served beer that was expired by 6 months. Always check the date on your beer if you order. They seem to stock old beer. Mediocre food. Service can be better. I came late afternoon that maybe the reason for the bad service. Ambience was good.

VL4Ic_3bs1snkCufwKjGYA.text: I've been here twice on trips to Scottsdale and the food is pretty good, but the service is terrible!  The waitstaff is not attentive or helpful in the slightest! For the price, I would expect better service. The lunch buffet is better than dinner because you don't have to rely in the waitstaff. They seem to have a fly problem, flies kept landing on my food, my face, and one got stuck in my water. If you've got endless time to wait for you food and can handle a waitstaff that acts like they have better things to do, then this is the spot for you! Otherwise, go elsewhere.

FD1OrWUdi6qIL4M02ox11w.text: As I'm crusin' from PHX airport to my hotel, I randomly see a sign for this Indian restaurant and immediately hit the brakes and make a U-turn to stop in for lunch!  I had my doubts, really I did.  I don't ever do Indian buffets because its guaranteed to disappoint me so I opted for the regular menu.  Delicious shrimp madras is what I got (extra spicy) and garlic naan...yummy, yum, YUM!

4iNX5UKIYjdgIun-wGlwkw.text: After moving from Flagstaff, I was looking for a new indian food restaurant that could meet the standards of the one I frequented up north. This place does not disappoint. The service is exemplary and the food is phenomenal. I highly recommend the chicken korma! It's my go to whenever I go!

VjWu9UWpRfZUPSLsl0W6SQ.text: Delicious! We had the vegetable curries, garlic naan, and a couple desserts. Very flavorful and the service was great. We will be going back.

ozpghIGvvxdGgfvJesnKdQ.text: This place was disappointing on different levels. First, the food was okay but not great. I thought the naan was below average and tasted more like flatbread than what naan is supposed to taste like. My dish was the chicken tikka masala and it just lacked flavor and any hint of spiciness. I did get the mango shake and it was truly excellent!  The waiter seemed quite inpatient throughout the night. On a couple instances he assumed what we meant instead of getting clarification; thus, bringing out the wrong thing. Then the restaurant turned off the music 10 minutes before closing and basically tried to rush us out. Seriously??? Not a way to keep business coming back! I mean, chill out... most of us were pretty much finishing up at that point so at least give the diners the courtesy of a full experience.  Too many better options to want to come back here...

7pZXIHc9Lii5xtaOik8HTQ.text: I haven't eaten a lot of Indian food so when I cam across this place on yelp, I was like cool, they have a buffet. Let's see what this is about. I went for lunch, it was like eleven dollars. The decor was nice but the food, not so such. It was okay, flavor wise but the buffet was small. There wasn't much to choose from and what was there was kinda old, looks like it was sitting out for a while. I basically just at the chicken Marsala and rice, which I enjoyed. Everything else just looked unappetizing due to the presentation. Maybe they do a better job for dinner, I don't know.

iFBB1AmEq9wYn28eCX4qgQ.text: I've been here regularly over the last at least 20 years (because I went to school with the kids of the owner) i love the lunch buffet but it is really hot or miss every day of the week depending on who the cook is. I've gone here multiple times a week to come to this conclusion. I love this place most of the time and I really recommend it most of the time.

TPm0iPZ9mRuzK1abkeFSQg.text: This is an exception Indian restaurant! My fiance use to deliver clay ovens to all the Indian restaurants in the valley and said this place had the cleanest back of house! The service and food are great! I've been here for dinner several times and my go to meal is shrimp korma, basmati rice, garlic naan, and a mango lassi to drink. I can't wait to try the lunch buffet sometime!

Rn5magHCRK6MHRWC43crrA.text: I called in to pick up the Aloo Gobhi, and was excited to see it was labeled "gluten free"! The gentleman was very accommodating and friendly. A beautiful restaurant. Will be back when in Phoenix again.

o39-9oSlgEoiWTM2Z2FioQ.text: Three words: chicken tikka masala. I've been to many Indian restaurants before and after eating here and no one even COMPARES to the chicken tikka here. We go for the buffet pretty much only for tikka masala! We ALWAYS receive extraordinary service, and the waiters always bring fresh, hot naan to us within minutes of arriving. ONLY complaint is that when we first started coming here years ago, there was actual cheese in the palak paneer. No more. There also used to be pistachios on the rice dessert. No more. I understand they may be trying to keep the price low, but I'd rather pay a little more and have the palak paneer made correctly. We will keep coming back and driving from Chandler because this place is always on point. Support your local businesses!

e-elQXAj5Xg0MP1frjyqtw.text: 2nd place I tired for Indian buffet. Tikka must have prepared differently or was sitting out to long. It had a gritty texture to it. I was underwhelmed with the buffet choices. Really hoping to find a place that does a korma on the regular.

JZpT9VAXx7-VNfhv2UlSMQ.text: First time visiting.  Good reviews looked good and they were accurate.  I have to admit, this was a great culinary experience, not just for my guests but also for me. I hadn't been to an indian restaurant since arriving in the USA.  It was worth the wait! Spice, heat, flavour, goodness. All in several dishes. Side note: the little store attached to the restaurant had a variety of sauces that I could only get in Australia. I will definitely be back to pick up local specialist items!

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9F6osgWJO5tbbllSpk_Bag.text: Rip off! Ordered take out and was charged $7.50 for 3 pieces of naan and $7 for two small containers of rice! What kind of an Indian restaurant charges for rice??!!! Unbelievable! Food was ok, nothing great!

2IehEaR1fffrxb9ZGzZYrA.text: I had the food delivered and ugh. I got Samosas and the first one was ok but the crust was really hard (not usually like that). The second appeared to be the same but when I bit into it... I don't know what was in there. It was hard and chewy like the filling had been in the freezer for 4 years and then was wrapped and fried. It was unidentifiable. I was supposed to be potatoes! Ewwww. After that I didn't even want to eat the tandoori chicken (although I risked it today and it was fine). I ordered off hours at 3:30 in the afternoon and last time I did that the order was fair but not disgusting. I should have taken a photo. Not ordering from there again.

jFpqkSit5yoqQN7mpJnuGg.text: Went for the lunch buffet and could not have been happier!  Everything was delicious and the staff was solicitous!  I will definitely come back and bring friends!  What a gem!

xQJ_vyv2N871ai5eG4TKIg.text: Great food, friendly people. I went with my book club, which meant we took over a 6-top for around 3 hours and they never batted an eyelash. Made us feel super welcome and even brought out a few extra treats while we were there. I ordered the shahi paneer and it was some of the best I've ever had.

OeeEyCQoEKBz2U8N0wUiNA.text: I love this place. Garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, and a chai or mango lassi are my go-tos. Service is always very attentive and friendly, always ensuring drinks are filled.  I like that you can customize your spice level so I don't have to worry about bringing guests that aren't used to the spice.

g2duSjFGfx5Cd-ED4Ym2dA.text: I have had take-out and the buffet here. It's good, but not what I would expect. I've been to a lot of different Indian places, so I had an expectation of the food that didn't quite fit with what they offer. Still good, just different.

ID-bL7alrSi46VJEwgAR3w.text: The ambiance of this place...I absolutely loved it. Its one of the nicer restaurants Ive been too, and the food was great.

85KL1mYxet3qgv9vcPHZiw.text: The service was good but the food wasn't my kinda food will go there again probably not Had

6iyLvY5QOj_8PMfBWAdpbA.text: GREAT Indian food ever will be back for sure   Holly in San Diego  Synergy World

jCaPxv06f3kZ8Ln4AvigMQ.text: A friend invited me to the buffet they have here for our birthday. Unfortunately it ended 2 minutes after we walked in the door at 4:30pm. So we opted for 2 complete dinner. It was allot of food, which I enjoyed for work the next day. Everything was delicious with the exception of some tough as nails plant in a very bitter/chemical like sauce. They should drop that item from the menu. It was just a small side dish and might be preferred by some, but I'd only serve it to people that ask for it. The Tandoori Chicken was outstanding along with the Shrimp Masal we had. Honestly, I would have been happy just eating the sauce.  All in all it was very good. I will go there again. I would recommend they serve their buffet a little later and they might get more just after work customers.  PS: They have some lovely Indian beers to enjoy. Try one.

cWfJjhGZEVoazdjlnwxZPA.text: Haven't been here in ages, but I still love the food. I am looking forward to our meal and the mango lassi.

0LhWsKIK6vj8xI2_Xx7W2Q.text: Food was fine, but had a rude waiter. When I asked for a condiment they forgot to give me, he was rude about it and acted as if I was asking for the world.

tVqZxHUle_1CHLA9SP1n3w.text: I wanted to like this so much as I am a HUGE fan of Indian cuisine, but it was mediocre at best. I ordered my favorite, Palak Paneer, hubby ordered Tandoori chicken and we got white rice and plain naan for the table. Naan was excellent and rice was plentiful and perfectly fluffy. Hubby's chicken was a little dry but flavorful. My dish tasted like watery spinach with no detectable spice or flavor let alone heat. I ordered a spice level 3 since this was our first visit; I have no idea what a level 1 would have been!! Overall, a disappointment and probably won't be back as there are plenty of other Indian places in the area. I did like their attached store... They had tons of rice, lentils, flours, spices, and ready made items for home cooks. Will be back for that.

8YGWpYn0-fnEt3X4DMtxNQ.text: Not so great. Having visited India many times, I am a connoisseur of Indian cuisine, and can handle medium spicy hot by Indian (West Bengal) standards. A friend recommended it to me. The best item on the buffet was the Gulab Jamon (sweet). I visited the establishment with my wife. We had their lunch buffet, and both of us not thrilled with the food. Service was OK. The lunch buffet is inexpensive, but this should not dictate the quality of the food. If they feel that they need to charge more in order to raise the quality, then that's what management should do. Until then, I'd skip this place for a while... Since I did not afterwards have the runs, I give it a two star!

rITyafz2Ldh-HEXLjYcYiQ.text: We ordered take out from this place through Postmates. The food was delicious. The chicken tikka masala was amazing...not super creamy...very spicy. It was a truly stand out dish. Everything else was good too and we got several items. The take out service was pretty fast. The four stars is because they didn't  serve rice with any of the dishes we ordered and most of them are usually served over rice. I had ordered a side of rice for the kids and that was the only rice that came with the meal.  We would definitely order from here again.

EbTJBMQ79xXGDdc2wbk-Zw.text: Was great! Pricing like all indian restaurants, by t great quality and flavor! Highly recommend.

84re8RkgJ5ZSgqJ7eYyVKw.text: On the up sideside staff was very attentive and nice. Food lacked any flavor. Parents use to eat here on occasion. Mom was with me on this visit and consensus was this was the worst Indian food we have had.

nCmMv_Rvaa15IH1xuDaj_Q.text: But of a love/hate scenario here. The food was delicious and they even have multiple vegan options. The only downside is they are not very friendly. Takeaway is the best of all options.

RJ0oWl6xS1GPJIMSTVarNA.text: Another Indian reviewer here. This place is a complete disappointment and I *never* eat there. A friend and I went for lunch once and became so aggravated at sitting and waiting at our table with no service that we were cussing under our breath by the time the waiter came, giving new meaning to the word "waiter".   The food is mediocre. I didn't like (or trust) the quality of the chicken in my chicken tikka masala. There is far better Indian food to be had throughout the Valley.

IEIjD9vTEct__0cD3mBc4g.text: Grabbed a lunch buffet to-go while running errands this afternoon. Priced at a reasonable $10 the styrafoam carton i packed with rice, veggie curries, pakoras, and tandoori chicken will feed me for days. Each to-go buffet is portioned one piece of delicious fresh naan.   The curries were just okay (palek paneer, daal makhaini,  and aloo mutter). Palek "paneer," while flavorful, was disappointingly served without the paneer, my favorite part. Both the daal makhaini, aloo mutter were watery. The pakoras tasted like yesterday's leftovers, reheated and thrown on the buffet line. Mint chutney was delicious, some of the best i've had. The raita, also watery, added an extra tang to the curries. The tandoori chicken (legs n' thighs) while tasty, are a bit dry.    Overall, I'd prefer the home-cooked and spicy palek paneer from Udupi Cafe. But for the price and convenience, the to-go lunch buffet from Indian Delhi Palace is a great deal.

wl61ufJ6FRiJ8OAx0UcnsA.text: Yum!!  The Chicken Tikka Masala, Bengan Bhartha (eggplant), rice, naan, and Punjabi lassis (one sweet, one salty) were all delicious.  The salty lassi was kinda interesting with different spices, not just salt.  For the entrees, the "medium" had just the right amount of heat.  Good sized portions too.  Five stars for food.    I would call the service "leisurely" but not bad.  It was definitely a team effort, with 4 different people approaching the table at various times and slight confusion at one point.    One thing to keep in mind: there's a party room upstairs, and you can totally hear the bass downstairs in the restaurant.  We asked to move to the other room, and then it wasn't as loud but we could still hear it.  We were hungry and had our hearts set on Indian food so we stayed, but this would not have been ideal for a special occasion or first date.  I don't know how often they have these parties, so to be on the safe side you may want to stick to weeknights here.

C3_HJIJNhSOfKegivHPpiw.text: In my mind, there are two types of Indian restaurants in the Valley that I can afford to eat at.  There's the ones in strip malls that typically feature a grouchy old man behind the counter and a huge TV displaying Indian MTV or soap operas, and largely do-it-yourself service. (See: Kohinoor)  If I'm feeling like spoiling myself, I'll take the next jump up to the places with painted walls, friendly waitstaff, and a-la-carte style menus instead of "specials."  After a long day at work and in hippy progressive meetings, me and my beyonce decided to try Indian Delhi Palace, which is an excellent example of the latter.  The waiters were attentive without  being overbearing, and the complimentary appetizer - I always forget the name - the crispy, slightly sweet cracker thingamajig with the green sauce? - was yummy.  And the samosas we started off with were also great.  Not overly greasy or soggy or stale like a lot of Indian places.  The palak paneer is wonderful!  Ask for it spicy if you are a fan of spicy foods.  The creamy spinach flavor doesn't become overbearingly hot, but has a pleasant spicy aftertaste that mixes perfectly with their garlic naan, served fresh, of the soft and chewy variety that I prefer.  RE: The people who miss paneer... The paneer was definitely on the skimpy side, but I didn't mind.  The taste was definitely still there - perhaps they blend it in more than other restaurants?  Anyway, if you are a huge fan of blocks of paneer in your food, you might want to mention as such to your server.  The lady ordered vegetable bhriyani, which is sort of our Indian comfort food, and it didn't disappoint.  Flavorful rice with tons of veggies.  Indian Delhi Palace has good food, good service, and an atmosphere that will embrace you like a vampire who feeds off of stress instead of blood.

6yp9RQ42aT29FOGTcrFzQg.text: So I had a toothache.  Heard that clover oil worked.  This lead my search for a local ethnic store and I voila: The Indian Delhi Palace.  They actually have a small grocery store attached to the restaurant.  As I entered the restaurant my world was curry.  My toothache disappeared and I wanted to sit down and grub.   Beautiful decor:  Very Indian, nice table sets and even nicer glass goblets and interesting utensils.    Service was excellent.  The curry chicken was DELISH.  Everything is A la carte.  So be prepared to pay for rice as a side dish.    I could've sworn the mango drink was freshly made.  Great companion to the spicy dish.  Ah the sweet and spicy.  Between my date and I everything came up to about 30 bucks.   If we had came in just an hour earlier it would've been 20 because of the buffet.  Oh well next time.  And there will be a next time.  Check out the grocery store as well.  They cater to those who want to prepare their own Indian variations.  My hunny promises he will be my guinea pig.

ZmSjPBSnI_edIueYDRYw0w.text: The food is good... The service is good. Again this comes from an Indian who did eat at EVERY possible Indian food restaurant in phoenix!!! Try the kheema(minced lamb) naan-its extremely filling. The butter chicken is good, and the portions are decent enough! Its family owned and operated so that is always a good sign!

PIcrxvAI45bC5cneuKhl9w.text: Delhi Palace has won my heart for Indian food.  There is a great lunch buffet that is well worth a drop in from time to time.  I'm not sure if this location is associated with the Delhi Palace on University, but I have been to both and liked both.  Sometimes Indian food buffets can feel not so fresh, but both of these restaurants keep things fresh and heated.    This restaurant has my stamp of approval as my favorite Indian food in the Phoenix area.

zEZSZnsNaZwaVkPnZ9EJhQ.text: We went to Indian Delhi Palace this weekend for their lunch buffet and were pretty dissapointed.  I would like to go back and try something off the menu, but I've had a better Indian buffet in Tempe.  The selection of food was quite limited and we had to wait forever for service.  The only saving grace was that the food we did have was pretty good.  The chicken tikka masala was really salty on the second trip to the buffet.  Strange almost like they dumped a cup of salt in.    I've heard this a great place so I'm probably going to give it one more try.  The best part of the lunch buffet was the price: $8.99 per person.

bTeo_9TTcsUfb2_uEFH7aA.text: This was my introduction into Indian food.    The first few times I came here I was like "ah not bad".  Then I started to try other places, even out of state and in other towns.   When I came back to IDP I really liked it.  If you go to a buffet, which I prefer, so you can try a bit of everything keep in mind that the dishes change daily.   If the food is not so good on Monday well go back on Tuesday and they'll have a few different items.  They had these parsnips once that were soooo good I've been having "nocturnal emissions" about them for the past year.   Cool little shop that is attached to the restaurant, they have fresh bakery items, Indian food stuffs, and a ton of Bollywood movies.

B_5VYA-hD7lEArRaw8H2cQ.text: My coworker and I had a craving for Indian. I had no idea this place was so close. Got in, sat down and within minutes the waiter was at our table. I didn't even have a chance to scan the menu...lunch buffet it was.  The buffet was decent but not very extensive. As another Yelper wrote, I'm not really into drumsticks but in a pinch I can eat it. The Tandoori chicken was really good and the Chickpea Masala Chaat was out of this world. Honestly, I could have just had the Chickpea salad with naan.  This restaurant is great for a quick lunch - they'll get you in and out in no time! I'm not sure what dinner is like here but am definitely open to checking it out..

Xhz9HrDJ02VdJM4sbLMYfg.text: price too high, and the food made my stomach uncomfortable

TnRg9vEr8IYxclrP5oeN-w.text: Finally, another Indian restaurant in Phoenix worth praising (Udupi is my other spot) -- we stopped in after work this evening for a quick bite, expecting the usual bagged frozen veggies in watered-down curry.  What we had was a hearty, flavorful, fresh, vegetarian meal. There is plenty of meat on the menu as well.  My wife and I both ordered the Vegetable Korma, which was full of fresh veggies in a rich, aromatic curry. We tried two different breads -- one was doughy and stuffed with cauliflower and the other was a crispy whole wheat. They were totally different from each other, yet both were fantastic.  Each staff member was friendly, responsive and never devoid of a smile. A nice, intimate atmosphere, perfect for a quiet and economical meal.  I will certainly be back soon... and will consider becoming a regular.

TL34hAlgKmGCXRyMZvIUmw.text: Needed a spot close to the airport. After reading reviews was skeptical but since we were going early gave it a shot. The food was fabulous and the big shocker was the service was excellent! Many reviews found the service horrible. We were very happy with our meal here and would return.

lax5RmaD4CPDk4FbePmxwQ.text: Amazing food and even better service. Also has a great atmosphere where they take good care of you and do not rush you. Really nice place to sit down and have a great meal.

CaKZlYW4-KUp2tJoIEJNmw.text: This is place is AWESOME! Don't get why it's not rated higher. They have Delicious Vegetable Curry and really good lunch buffet. The Naan is off the HOOK. Everyone I know that has eaten here loves it and this place has been awarded by NEW TIMES as well. Seriously you should come here. I usually get take out because I have small kids but the service is always great and the food is Delicious.

ni2iDWJkumk5IXL4FQWahA.text: I really want to give this place more than 3 stars.  I like the food and the restaurant and the banana milk shakes!  BUT!  in the little Indian store to the right of the restaurant there were rat traps all over the place....  with rotten cheese in them...  THAT is not something I, a paying customer wants to see....  AT LEAST hide the traps.  THEN it made me think, that my food could have been contaminated with rat droppings and then my stomach started hurting.  Which is unfortunate because I probably won't be back, and we had been there quite a few times.

t9OGlsw98RqvlJ3gU6NaIQ.text: Decent. The dishes are somewhat bland and seem to be not quite as authentic as I have had in the past. The curry was ok and the tikka masala, well Ive had better. The buffet is above average and as always the Naan was wonderful!

_y1MoIE1OFga9qPhD-eIXw.text: It's a good lunch buffet and they don't take you to the cleaners.  I enjoyed the Chicken Tandoori and Curry Chicken,.  I would have preferred that they would have used boneless chicken but it was still good.  I also liked the rice pudding!  As my friend Jessica F stated, make sure you print the $5.00 coupon from their website!

KucdBGEUisSQ08Rx4MqGnw.text: Stopped in for lunch, and it was definitely a solid "meh."  Lunch buffet is $8.99, which was a bit steep considering the lack of selections (only 2 chicken dishes, chicken curry and tandoori chicken, neither spectacular).  The vegetable curry was fine but again, nothing special, and everything else was quite bland.  I won't be returning.

U27_vt3vHlcUdt5YJIYUdg.text: Nice little lunch buffet at a fair price. They had a fantastic chick pea salad and I really liked the Tandori Chicken and rice pudding. I even got a $5.00 off coupon on their website, which made it a very economical lunch choice.

9YwJQBDRaVzy6sdOidEUOA.text: My husband and I went here for the lunch buffet. The atmosphere is very nice, and the food tasted wonderful. So, what's the rub? Their palak paneer had no paneer! There was a full tray of the curry only. My husband asked about this, and the waiter said he'd find out. When my husband asked again, the waiter said the kitchen had chopped up the paneer and put it in the curry. I don't like calling people liars, but when we sampled some we didn't see or taste and cheese. I've been to India and never seen such a thing, and my friends from India haven't either. One thing I love about Indian food that separates it from other curries is that they have cheese curry, so this was quite the bummer. If you aren't a stickler like me, you will love this place. Excellent flavor on everything.

qyDbJTWAAw6_RxYnnug2_g.text: We've recently moved to Phoenix and we've been looking for a fantastic Indian restaurant (and I think we've found it!)  The restaurant is nice, with nice decor. The service was friendly and quick. The waiter was a pro and we loved one to ten spicy-scale for our dishes. I ordered Veggie Korma, he got the Chicken Tikka Masala,  and we shared some Naan and the 'assorted snacks' (Vegetable Pakora, Samosa, Sheesh Kabab, Papadum). Everything was DELICIOUS. Giant food baby. We'll be back for the lunch buffet and we can't wait.

YH7bazNq8XmWi2-By1Xh6g.text: I was very surprised to see that this location is a great advancement from the Tempe location. I love the Tempe location (due to it being the best in proximity), but everything about this location is better.   As far as the food goes, it's just as "top-notch" as Tempe. All the food is hot and fresh, and they are constantly bringing in warm bread and new refills.  The chicken curry is even better with the addition of red and green bell peppers, but everything else is just as tasty.  The building the restaurant is located in is perfect. It looks like it was built for this restaurant alone, and I gotta say I was impressed. There was even an Indian Grocery inside which was cool to look around in.  I had a great experience here and I'm sure anyone else who enjoys Indian Cuisine would as well.

IsO6kauCNXuSOJAbg5S0EQ.text: Decent but not awe inspiring North Indian style food in east Phoenix. I haven't been for their lunch buffet in years, but dinner is good and reasonably priced. Their idea of hot is not that hot.  Things to try that I especially like here -  Mango pickle Any of the paratha breads Hot tea Anything with cauliflower

yQ5ah-n1Dxo1b_37rTJckw.text: Two reasons for coming here:  1) You love Indian Food 2) You love to sample a variety of dishes   My first visit to the palace was on a Friday, for the lunch buffet.  For $7.99, you have your pick of Tandoori Chicken, a delicious chicken Curry, Three Vegetable Curries, Basmati Rice, Daal, Naan, and. Salad. To complete your feast, they offer Kheer (rice pudding with almond and pistachio) and Gulab Jamun (Two balls akin to donut holes - made from cream of milk in scented light syrup).  The greatest thing about this buffet is that it is "western" friendly.  This means that none of the curries are too spicy, and even the mint chutney is not over-powered by peppers and chilies.  For your first experience with Indian food, this is a terrific spot.  If a seasoned veteran of this cuisine, you may be more picky where flavor is concerned.  I personally feel the buffet had very slim pickings, especially for someone that enjoys diversity in dining.  However, I thought the tikka masala, chicken curry, daal, pakoras, and saag were sooo delicious.  I am interested in returning here to explore its dinner options.  For example, along with the varying lamb, chicken, and vegetarian dishes Indian Delhi Palace offers - they have complete dinners for under $20.  For instance, the chicken dinner includes One Papadum, One Tandoori Chicken, Chicken Curry, One Daal Maharani, One Plate of Basmati Rice, One Naan, One Ratia, One Dessert, Chutney and Tea.

R_Ru0EKzH8orcD-loZ7t8Q.text: My favorite Indian restaurant in Phoenix!!!  Generous portions and great service. Your water is never empty which is a big deal for me when I eat spicy food.  Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Vindaloo and Aloo Matar are my personal favorites here. Their naan is also great.  Try their lunch buffet and you will not be disappointed.

w0Yq9bxCgjPkKUhpz3IDzA.text: Delhi Palace saved my dinner party! I was getting over a nasty 24-hour bug, and was panicked about how on earth I was going to be able to pull off a vegetarian duel birthday dinner party for my Scorpio-signed, non-meat eating folks.   My boyfriend suggested ordering a bunch of food for everyone. I was non-too-thrilled by this suggestion, but felt I had nothing better to offer. Cooking, cleaning and preparing for the party would have surely put me over the edge, so I went along with it.  The responsibility of ordering for everyone sort of put me in a state of quiet anxiety, but I knew I needed to bite the bullet.  Ordering for 13 people I got the following:  APPS 3 Vegetable Pakora (6/order) apps - too salty, over done, wouldn't order again 5 Samosa (2 large per order) apps - we split them in 2 so there would be 20. They were gone in minutes.  So delicious, and really reasonable at $2.49/order DINNER 1 Vegetable Korma - excellent, should have ordered 2 of them 2 Daal Maharani - excellent, and there was nothing left 2 Bengan Bharta - too salty, wouldn't order this again, hardly touched 2 Palak Paneer - excellent, a True hit 1 Malai Kofta - delicate and delicious  Oh, how could I forget, we ordered lots of Garlic Naan, and a platter of Basmati rice.  The apps came with mint chutney and tamarind chutney, and I ordered raita (cool whipped yogurt) to drizzle over the spicy preps.  Dinner was around $170. It was entirely worth it.  No stress, no mess, and everyone was thanking us for the Indian treats. Plus, we had Indian food for dinner the next night!  What I gleaned from this experience was I could have definitely ordered less food.  There was tons of left overs.  I would say that one dinner dish safely satisfies 2 guests.  Favorites were: Palak Paneer, Vegetable Korma, Daal Maharani, Garlic Naan, Samosas.  One last thing, this place has the best Indian Buffet in town... if you're into that sort of thing (wink).

uT9tZzVco1x5iRU6hzaA-A.text: We arrived at 2:30 with a craving for something that wasn't mexican food or contemporary food. We were seated and told there was a lunch all-you-can-eat buffet going on. We looked over the menu but decided after all on the buffet, it was a good idea to try some new things since I always get matar paneer.   I filled a plate and proceeded to stuff my face.. in classy form, of course. The Aloo Mattar had the perfect amount of spice and an immense amount of flavor. It was impressive, as was the chicken curry, the rice, and the chicken masala. I was in heaven! The garlic naan was perfect. Everything was right with the world..  Then the bad news came. Not fifteen minutes after we sat down with our first plates filled were we told the buffet was going to close soon. Had we known earlier, well, I'm not sure what we would do. But it sure is lucky we are a couple of small ladies who can't really eat more than one overfilled plate.. I thought.  I finished my plate and decided to have more aloo mattar, rice, and then some raiti and fritters. Then I got some of the coconut basmati rice. Oh everything just.. sighhh. I think it was the first time I've really been rendered speechless by food in a long time.   tl;dr Service was friendly but didn't come around often enough to fill our drinks, food is incredible, the place is relaxing and aesthetically appealing inside.  They lost a star for the failure to tell us we had fifteen minutes to enjoy the buffet and for being a little lagging on the refilling of drinks.

gFq_lzO_pRNqKR4SnExtQA.text: Big fan of this place despite the fact that it appears they changed the recipe of their Malai Kofta the last time I was there.   Their naan is delish! Combining a little malai kofta and palak paneer with their naan will get you laid on the first date. Money back guarantee. From me, not them. I usually get it to go and order ahead of when I think I need to because it tends to take just a bit longer than I love to get the food.   But all and all my experiences here have always been very good. Great Indian food in Phoenix.

HxoMthB3oTK5kxJAB-1IYg.text: Food is always great and the service is very attentive... We'll go back another day.

pu4MdVR0KVh_ee_ZCXxtww.text: Lately, I can't seem to get enough of South Asia in my belly. I have my Valley favorites (India Gate in Chandler and The Dhaba in Tempe), but I wanted to give a new joint a go. So I decided to try the rather palatial-looking India Delhi Palace in East Phoenix because I had heard good things about its lunch buffet.  Luckily, my foodie friends aren't liars.   I arrived shortly before the lunch rush. I was greeted promptly and politely. I then asked if the buffet had a large selection of vegetarian options, and he actually gave me a brief but thorough tour of the veggie offerings, which, much to my delight, comprised much of the buffet. I promptly filled my plate with aloo matar and daal maharani. But don't worry, omnivores; there were plenty of delicious-looking meat dishes on the slate as well.   The food was very tasty, but what makes this place stand up above other Indian buffets was the exceptional, attentive service. A team of servers worked to make sure I received fresh naan with my meal, my water glass was always filled and any questions I had were answered. I don't expect much in the way of help when it comes to buffets, so this was a pleasant surprise.   I will definitely be back one of these days to try something from the menu (bengan bhartha, I'm looking at you).

0om22GKV3vwbNDL-SH2jFA.text: A craving for Indian food.. popped in here about 230p...The waiter seemed a bit annoyed when we didnt sit and jump right at the buffet..BUT I hadnt had time to look..buffet or no..offer the menu! All in all....since I couldnt decide, my friend and I opted for garlic naan and the buffet.. Chicken curry is a fav of mine..but maybe Im spoiled..I like it to contain more than chicken legs .. Ive actually only had it boneless.. (probably not traditional.!).. I liked the curry , but not the chicken.. Im kind of a white meat girl... Loved the daal... the fritters, the raita.. the mango lasse.. the aloo mattar... yum... a new fav... NOW heres where they FAIL... not 5-8 minutes after agreeing to the buffet and serving ourselves... the waiter comes back and asks if we are done with the buffet.. Kind of a WTH look came across our faces?? I mean did he kind of lure us to buffet it...away from menu...just to rush us ?? Yeah...no.. wrong... SO, we proceed to get another selection of items on another plate.. small table now full.. as they took away the buffet.. I mean, are you serious!? Just let a customer know that when they sit... 'oh btw, get your buffet.. if not its going away...'..  The naan rocked.. its large and enough for 3... I just always feel at a buffet per norm.. I dont get my moneys worth.. I dont eat alot.. So I sample when at buffets... this lunch buffet, for the short time it was 'there'... was priced right..

1G6dS3irNnVx8tKO60GKBg.text: I like. I don't get over here that often, but when I do, I always have a good meal. With restaurants that vary their spice levels according to your taste, it's always nice when you find one where your medium hot corresponds to their medium hot and so on. Too many times I've ordered 4/5 for spicy and gotten a 2/5 of 6/5 (yes, that's a thing that can happen). Their naan is delicious, always served hot and fresh baked. The Madras Shrimp are great if you can take the heat, if not, the butter chicken is everything butter chicken should be. Mango kulfi for dessert! Or gulab jamun, as fun to say as it is to eat.

0Ibn11-i40umRaKcRICmYg.text: Very satisfying fix for my travel-induced Indian food craving. Delicious lamb biryani and an eggplant dish the name of which I can't recall. Attentive, perhaps slightly pushy service. Definitely recommend.

Tqk4US_6HFL4HxnAw-b4TQ.text: I am hoping for a little bit of London here in Phoenix with this Indian Resturant. Fingers crossed!!!!

Fq4wBOVIkHQE4QWuKkxmbQ.text: We stopped in here for the ubiquitous lunch buffet, and I am a little torn because I wanted to either really like it, or really hate it. But I don't.   It seems that decent Indian is hard to come by out here, so I tend to stick with the same couple of places.My usual Indian haunt is Flavors of India, because the food is mostly good and it's close, but I think this place is a close second. The things that Flavors does well, Delhi Palace does so so on. And vice versa.   Where Delhi Palace shines: (within the confines of today's buffet, of course)  Palak Paneer- even though the paneer was noticeably absent or microscopic Bengan Bhartha- My eggplant-hating dining companion even liked it.  Mutter Paneer- The one dish with peas that i'll eat willingly.  The service- they weren't in your face, but they were around more than most buffet meals.  The atmosphere- it's classy without being over the top gaudy.   Where Flavors of India kicks Delhi Palace's hiney:  Naan- I prefer the flattened, nearly scorched naan to the fluffy puff that was plopped on the table here. It was fresh though, so bonus points for that.  Tandoori chicken- The flavor was fantastic, but the meat was dry.  Yellow lentil daal- I'll save my colorful description of this one and just leave it at Blech.  Curry chicken- Where's the spice? Possibly the blandest curry chicken ever.  The water- This sounds weird, but every time the server came by to refill water, we ended up with more UFOs (unidentifiable floating objects) in our glasses.   Overall, I think it's a toss-up. The things that I like about Delhi Palace are the things that my old stand by place doesn't do well. I'll definitely be back, but not for the curry or lentils.

iDX7q1OG73XhReYkECEAjA.text: I went here once with a friend.  We had the lunch buffet which was average.   Until, I saw two cockroaches crawling around. Not, even your normal cockroaches but, gigantic cockroaches.  I couldn't eat anymore but, for some odd reason my other friend did.

s5b_Qf27eqs-AWbBKpNfPA.text: It was our first time here so we had to have the defaults to judge the quality.  Everything was well prepared and spiced well.  You can actually taste the flavor of the spices and the heat doesn't kick in till you stop eating.  Any other restaurant we can normally eat super spicey, but we went conservative of 4 out of 10 and that was perfect.  The food is hearty stick to your ribs.  Two dishes, a rice and two naans was enough food for three plus enough leftover for a fourth diner.  So even though the prices are a bite high, it works out in the end.  Mango Lassi - creamy and refreshing, not too sweet Chicken Masala - sauce was a little thick but well spiced Malai Kofta - sauce was a better consistency but was not a fan of the homemade cheese balls Peas Pulaou - ok Plain and Garlic Naan - both good but the garlic one kicks it up a notch.

dl7-9cHPGI7LJ2-Mn0_uYA.text: Awesome vegetarian food here. We tried shahi paneer and dum aloo . Both were awesome and naan was fantastic!!.though mango lassi was disappointing!!!

hjkAlRUltcWWBO9BMduF8A.text: I came here on August 20th to pick up an order that I placed over the phone. I had ordered garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, and vegetable pakora. Everything tasted EXCELLENT! The reason for the terrible review? Being conned into paying for rice. RICE! Something that should be included with a meal (the masala).   I ordered this to go, so I did not check my order until I got into my car to leave. Upon inspection, there was no rice. I went back in and asked for the rice. I was told by a young man that I would have to pay. I don't think any one eats these entrees without rice. . . so I said ok. As I was being rung up, and the man having NO IDEA how to ring me up for rice (clue number 1 I was being conned). . . another man came up and was trying to help him. He also had no idea how to ring this up. And then ANOTHER gentleman came up and said "Oh, you forgot the rice? You will need to refund. . . " while young man number was trying to shush him. All of this happened without anyone acknowledging me and I ASSUMED that I would not be charged. Nope, I was.  All for $3.89. Food is GREAT. . . service and being conned earned you 1 star.

BYNRwPFLWqhWqijzhYiT9A.text: This is a great restaurant. During lunch hours, food served at the buffet is virtually not spicy and really good but the best part comes after. During regular hours, the food is rich and spicy, meals have a unique taste that will spice you up. Chicken Tikka Massala is the best in my opinion, served with some Jasmin Rice and some lentils. The naan is very good, has a buttery taste that goes great with your meal. The personnel is really kind and willing to help, Gary is one of the best, he makes sure that everything is ok and nothing is missing in your table.  Price is decent during lunch hours and is competitive for a dinner

y6JPR94WflcLFjDnw8v8nQ.text: This was our first visit to this location for a birthday dinner.  The food had great flavor though i was not super impressed as the quality of food is the same you could get at any indian restaurant.   What you dont get at the other restaurants is the indian style decor and ambiance.   The architecture of the building inside and out is very pretty and fun. They now serve "dirty mango lassi".. yummy!  Pro- the food was hot and the dishes are different than what you would see ata typical indian restaurant in the USA.  The chia tea was delicious.  Con- i dont think the price of the food matched the quality but i say you should go and see for yourself.   The garlic naan was not garlic flavored and not much to write home about.  The service did not meet normal expectations as they didnt use seat assigment when delivering food so it was like a cattle auction on who ordered which dish.  Also, the server was not attentive so we have to chase him down a couple of time. We were missing dishes and had to ask for them more than once. Dinner was at 6:30 and we didnt get to leave until 9:30.  Even for a party of 9, 3 hours is way too long.  We were waiting for them more often then the restaurant waiting for us.    I understand not all places will split a check so this is more of an FYI.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fn4uFViCsMQ20harbAUqbA.text: Not a bad spot to check out at all. Great place to drop by and grab a quick lunch if you are in the area.   The location has plenty of parking and serves thier buffet from 11-4:30 for lunch, which is great if you are running late for lunch during the week.  They offer many of the familar basics and the food is brought out pretty consistently.  The flavors are good, not great and not very spicy. Most items are mild, which is probably done so that it can suit more people.  I am used to most being at least medium.  The location has comfortable seating and lots of it. They are attentive and it is very clean. They have both meat and vegetarian options as well and they are served on separate parts of the buffet.    Check them out if you are nearby and if you have never tried indian food because you are worried it's too spicy, this may be a good place to give it a try.

70wD4FsXVgA-xn3ptPew9w.text: Just OK.  I had my heart set on some Goat Curry, but all they have is chicken on there buffet. The food was good, nothing surprising either way. The restaurant is clean and service is good.

POdri8OdJWG4fg78Wlh8PA.text: We were introduced to Indian Delhi palace by Indian friends who are very particular about their cuisine. The food is great. We like to try a variety of foods and have eaten at dozens of restaurants serving Indian dishes. This is by far the best. Try the lunch Buffett for starters. That way you can taste a wide variety of dishes and select your favorites for when you return for dinner on a subsequent trip. Service is good and setting is pleasant

I10A0VlBpwwgLyxcTqJiTw.text: Only been here once and ordered take out to enjoy in my friends backyard. Food was good and the host was really great to accommodate some last minute additions. I don't live in Phoenix so not sure when I'd be back but would definitely eat here again.

gLlRAnp8iCjZIhj-7lGvhw.text: Great food!!!! I had the chicken tikka masala my roommate hade yellow chicken curry. The sauce here is amazing on both dishes and the waiters refilled my beverages consistently. The waiter also made great recommendations on what he enjoys(masala). The place is neat and clean. I'll definitely be back for my cravings for good chicken or fish bathed in sauce with a side of rice. Only downfall is that the side dishes are extra (rice) its not much considering the quality of the food. I wouldn't come if i was on a budget anyway. Great service great food! Ill be back.

7nKEmEOHGaw3rwCtis-SNA.text: Avoid this place. Charges for everything. You can read other reviews. Food was not the greatest. Better Indian food elsewhere.

_ObjTQh-yK5zqcSfER13CQ.text: This was the " non vegetarian dinner" that costs almost 20$. I ordered on Grubhub for pick up, when we got there we were told they just got the order and they had sealed this container with cling wrap so couldn't see inside till we got home. After being out all day and tired and first meal at around 9 pm we were too exhausted to go back and I just stomached the rice underneath with some naan bread. This was a gross disgrace to be served that and they didn't include the chutney, tea, raita or chicken curry, just this nasty mush.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Non veg dinner taken to go. Gross
Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9wrixG2-wDngbe9crHodow.text: Ordered butter chicken, it wasn't butter chicken. It was curry with old tandoori chicken (probably left over  from their buffet)....don't recommend this place at all!!

bIppYF63MgE3qsttEPlRTA.text: The first time we had Indian Delhi takeout, we would have given it 4 stars possibly. Combined with our most recent experience, it's gone down to 3 stars.  The cooking of the food is pretty inconsistent. We've ordered the same dishes more than once (saag paneer, tikka masala, chana masala) and they can taste completely different every time! Like the actual taste of the dish can be totally different depending on which cook is working that day. Also when you tell them the level of spiciness, this is also wildly inconsistent. Once we got "spicy" and it was so spicy that it gave us stomachaches and it was a challenge to finish the dishes. And seriously, we are people who love spice. We love to have our mouths burned. But this was insane. And then another time we got "medium spicy" for one dish and "spicy" for another dish, and neither were any detectable level of spicy.  They also gave us chicken in one dish when we ordered lamb, and it said lamb on the receipt, and we paid for lamb.  Overall, we like the dishes, and they're good, but it's become too much of a gamble to order from here and so we're more than likely to look elsewhere next time we need our Indian food fix.

no5TEHmh1d2rCqrlLdXmmg.text: I went here for the first time with a co-worker as we wanted to try some Indian cuisine.  Co-worker has never tried it before and I've only had it maybe twice before this.  We enjoyed it for the most part.  We did the lunch buffet and sampled every single item that was offered.  At just under $11 including tax, I felt it was reasonable.  I found that many of the items were moderately spicy and this could be an issue to someone who is sensitive to spiciness.  Our favorite thing hands down was the veggie pakora - the deep fried mixed veggie fritter.  Their naan was also delicious and my second favorite thing.  Service was great - no complaints!  Yes, we would consider returning as time and mood allows.

5Rz7_vxIqd9cgIaCMzwCvg.text: Food was poorly flavored, both our curry and our tikka masla tasted similar and were spicier than expected when choosing a level of 1 out of 8. Tikka masala lacked the coconut taste. Naan bread was excellent.

oT0fZ7J1-b8YHsBj2OA4QQ.text: Love the food here! I love their gulab jamun and their chicken tikka Marsala. Lunch buffet is great but during dinner time the menu is pricey. Geri is a great! I love coming here for the food and the staff being so attentive to us.

i9xzm4ntk3LH82zcLdSMAQ.text: We've been here 3-4 times since my first review.  Fewer flies and everything is great.  This is our go to place for great tikka masala.

Dv2TeRloZ-fv6Yb_ddqwrg.text: NOT impressed!  We eat Indian at least once every 2 weeks our entire life. This was the WORST I've had. Extremely limited menu and OVER priced( Bill was over $100 for 5 adults and one child) no paneer ( when asked I was told some people don't like it so they don't make it) palak was thick and dry and not creamy, tandoori chicken was dry and when we went back twice to get some for my 9 year old daughter ( who barely ate anything but was charged full adult price)  it was gone and no more was made.  Some dishes were overly spicy...Naan was just ok.. owners were cold and unfriendly. I won't ever go back ..I've had way better Indian food .

sFTKk-5GzubCxOsqWv66zg.text: So came in here a few days ago and today I saw my credit card statement and there are two charges: one for the amount I owed and another for nearly $170. What?!   I go in today and ask about it and there's no manager on the premises (went in around 12). Made me wait about 10 min...finally got a hold of the manager and he tells me that their machine sometimes does that. YOUR RESTAURANT SOMETIMES CHARGES PEOPLE $170???????????????????????   The food is decent but there's plenty of places that come without this inconvenience. Won't be returning.

FfY7pLSJ1eZhYQYCpHvlpA.text: After several friends recommended the lunch buffet here, I decided to give it a try. I came on a weekday at 11:30 and mine was the only car in the parking lot, so I decided to go do a quick errand in one of the area establishments. I came back just a few minutes after noon and the parking area was packed - a good sign. The dining area has plenty of seating for individuals or groups of different sizes, and I was given a seat at a table for two. Water and a basket of freshly made naan bread quickly followed.The buffet offered most of the Indian restaurant standards. I sampled a bit of everything and found most of the offerings to be very good, except for the pakora (vegetable fritters) which were on the dry side. I came back for more servings of aloo matar and chicken tandoori, which I liked the most from the array served that day. Service is very friendly and the price for the lunch buffet was very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. India Delhi Palace, on McDowell and 51st Street.

HJvO7bEdv-0dzWaeL_lWhw.text: We were the only people in the entire restaurant. So no idea how service is when/if it gets busy, but our service was prompt. However, we didn't eat a $3 item because it wasn't fresh and tasted bad and our server insisted it was good and didn't take it off our bill. Also, we were sat where we could hear clanging pans and dishwashing happening.  The food was not the best Indian food I've ever had, not the worst, just okay. My biggest issue was that we were there for an early dinner and it seemed like most of it had just been transferred from the lunch buffet. It definitely wasn't fresh and vibrant like good Indian food can be.  Final note, my SO doesn't like anything too crazy spicy, so ordered medium spiciness for everything. However, the soup we ordered was too spicy for him to eat. Once we paid I found on the receipt that the soup had been input as spice level 7 and our entrees, which weren't very spicy at all, were input as spice level 4. Why?

B7r4HrbhCUOm5PmpsEsyzA.text: WOW! Haha...yeah this place is cool. Just looking at it makes me feel cool. Not gonna lie, I was a little skeptical coming here because honestly, it's not in the best part of town, but it's great. Come here. I judge a place by its Chicken Korma my favorite Indian dish. And this place did a fantastic job. The Biryani was a little lack luster but it still had great flavor. The cashier guy was super nice, he engaged in painful small talk with me haha. That's a plus! And man! BOLLYWOOD MUSIC! I got my food to go so I didn't get a chance to get the whole experience as a sit down customer but I'm sure it's just as good. Enjoy! Thank you!

8vh9Yf3oQGt09LCFDJeCPw.text: Went in at 6 pm on a Sunday. Restaurant had perhaps 3 tables sat. We were sat in a part of the restaurant near all the other tables. Received water and menus. Waited over 15 minutes for someone to take our order.   When we flagged someone down we were told they were short staffed but still no one came over to apologize or take our order. Waited another 5 minutes and left. While we were waiting one couple waited the entire time at the register to pay their check and another man dining alone was in the same situation and walked out.

M9FJiVfSuygTr0H8REw-7Q.text: Amazing food! Excellent, excellent, excellent food. Great service. Clean and friendly service. A must eat restaurant Indian food restaurant. Prices are goo as well.

LBby56k2XzPh9RaBsEPitA.text: So good! Their rice is the best rice we've had in a long time. The servers are also very nice and helpful. They will ask how everything was and if they can do anything else for you, which wasn't typical of the last Indian restaurant we used to go to. This place was a must go. Garlic naan was awesome too!!!

kvUdtfdqPF-vyK-8lM9C_A.text: Not a bad place, great service.. Went for the lunch buffet, They can use a little more selection, tikka masala was good chicken was tender, couple vegetarian dishes, chicken kabob was dry. Naan is fresh made to order, I personally like the garlic naan. One good thing is that the buffet is open till 430pm..

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic Naan

-k9PF9QCsPJNzkGMl-NW9Q.text: Had a craving for Indian food in the area and decided to try this place out. The ambiance was very Indian-themed and provided a nice environment. The host and the staff were inviting and friendly but not talkative, which was perfectly fine.  As for the food, I had the lunch buffet which included a sampling of the goat korma, aloo matar, tandoori chicken, and chicken tikka masala. They also provided a fresh piece of buttered naan bread on the side which was good but not amazing as it was a bit doughy than how I usually have had my naan. The chicken tikka masala was good but the chicken was slightly dry. The tandoori chicken was great as it was flavorful and moist. The goat korma was decent, as it was pretty similar to the lamb korma's that i have had before. The aloo matar was also very tasty.  Overall the meal was enjoyable and the buffet was quite fresh as none of the dishes tasted old (I cannot say the same about copper kettle's buffet). The price is reasonable a for the amount of food.  As for comparisons, I believe The Dhaba is better quality and flavor wise but they don't have buffets and they are pricier than most Indian restaurants. Copper Kettle had better naan but this place has them beat in freshness and cleanliness.

DxysOPinTAMsIvzSCLjswQ.text: I went to this place on my trip to Arizona and Phoenix. Ambience, location and staff is pretty nice. The food was average. Me being from bay area may be a little rude but the food just had the taste of cream. Ordered for the following dishes: Malai kofta: koftas tasted frozen Paneer: panner was good but gravy was all cream Onion pakoras were awesome I would may be go there if no other option is available, but then it could be just my taste buds.

vC_C3JNlxsU8_7lT9ivMSA.text: Awesome food with good service  non veg thali is good combo also taste of mango lassi is So delicious

NMVwdh6TVXG0f9Z9enhJnw.text: Used their catering service for an event at home. Was initially concerned with the timing of delivery but the service and food covered that part. All the guests appreciated the delicious food. Will definitely recommend to friends and family.

fihMAnef-wcIM9jw7E3Vdw.text: I have eaten at this place four times in the last two years. Initially I was not a big fan of it, but in the last year the food at this restaurant has gotten so much better.  My husband and I are big paneer fan, we loved their Shahi Paneer, and Malai Koftas of their Ala carte menu. Their Raita is really good too. The only draw back is that they charge for plain rice. Usually rice is given with curries for free. I chose to over look that glitch because the food was so good. I hope this helps!

DPFkP2QieBO-aZXOjlqhbA.text: Don't be put off by the fact that they're super rude on the phone, it's probably cultural, and the food is totally worth it! Have eaten almost every vegetarian dish on the menu and d*mn do they do it right! Amazing flavor, spice level is pretty precise. If ur going to get a 7/10 you'll need a water standing by, other than that its amazing spices as you requested.  Bf is in love with the Mixed Grill- as a non meat eater I have to say: it looks and smells AMAZING! And per his review its the best things he's ever eaten. A little pricey at 18$ but he says its worth it. Watching him eat it- I completely agree. :)  Been eating here for the past 3 years and even though the customer service has yet to take a giant step forward I still keep stepping through their doors, inhaling those delicious spices, picking up my 'to go' order and grinning like a thief as I enjoy it for days and days to come. :)

yGlbtKLCav7E_PSVU2rBYA.text: My go-to Indian food place. The staff is always attentive and friendly. My bf left his credit card in the restaurant once and a hostess chased us down as we were about to drive away. The food is great! It's nice because they adjust the spice level for you from 1-10 and the lunch buffet is relatively not spicy.  I usually order chicken tikka masala, rice, and garlic naan and I always have leftovers for the next day. This is a welcoming place and a good restaurant to introduce your friends to Indian food.

6lSAYBqUYANs5YnY109PIQ.text: This place looks amazing however compared to the the "Delhi Palace" on university and rural this places food was not up to par. Maybe I'm just partial but I didn't enjoy the flavored. On top of that, I asked if the garlic nan was included with buffet and was told YES then charged for it when it was time to pay. I left unhappy and still craving good, spicy chicken tikka masala and had to go to the original.

nyIyAcUW2q8WlQ7Kao037g.text: Seriously good Indian food. Ordering spice is actually spice. Good blend of spices. Chicken tikka delish! I've had dinner and the buffet - both were very good. Fresh naan brought to your table during buffet. Lots of choices all very tasty. Too bad I live in another state and it will be a very longtime before coming here again.

GWkbArBv3n_Dfdvh_B4iFg.text: This is my favorite Indian lunch buffet. A nice selection of entrees. The restaurant is always clean and the service is excellent. A good value for the money.

-h_Wn4Sstz-EVtxoTUsVRg.text: $10 unlimited and quality lunch buffet with fresh naan bread brought to the table. It can't really be beat. What's extra nice is the cleanliness and decor of this restaurant. It feels much fancier than you'd think with their maroon tablecloths and dark wood furniture.  The lunch buffet is very good, it has chicken tandoori and chicken masala, but also had all the regular vegetarian options and good chutneys. Everything was fresh and the servers were really attentive. I'll be back!

FQm1WuupI1epPmBKHDSXyA.text: Definitely worth checking out. Obviously not the best, but they have some good stuff. The restaurant itself provides a nice atmosphere. Some of the food items are a bit bland, but not all were like that.

GDEalX_03X3bgvvjME6jaA.text: I've had Indian food everywhere and this was just fantastic. Love their lunch buffet 11-4:30pm

npS0oPHoWjjdx8BTfSaF3Q.text: I love their lunch buffet.  I always forget what I love most, so dinner is very hard for me.. Decisions decisions.

NesVSqP3xr7Fvoe_W1riMw.text: Went to the buffet, none of the tastes good expect naan. Potato curry smelled bad and they removed it after complaining. Items are not fresh.

ME2CoqkAvdmyP0NXhqquYw.text: It was my first time here. I did lunch Buffett. Great food and bread. Fast service. Great price. This is a winner. Thank you

SjF9AvSrCwOBxpVqeji_eg.text: I haven't been here in a few years, but the buffet is a must. It's a pleasure to have all the choices in front of you. The raita was too runny, but the naan is the bet I've ever had. Don't miss out on ordering it on the side.

c27KtKu1lFGrjkXYwajmug.text: There was a time, in infancy of this restaurant, that it was one of our go to lunch spots for our growing and thriving DotCom.  I had taken my daughters here countless of times. However, over the years, its luster had faded away as far as our palate appeal was concerned. There was never really anything wrong, it was just that there were now so many options, and we drifted away from one of the places that used to be our standard for Indian Cuisine Buffets.  My daughter had flown into town to greet her Dad a Happy Birthday, before she jets off to another country in a few days.  Since here memories of this place were no longer as vivid, she wanted to catch up and relieve one of her childhood standards.  This place is still quite elegant, and well appointed. The buffet has the typical dishes that one would expect; e.g., Tandoori Chicken, Tikka Masala, Basmati Rice, Saag Paneer, and several others.  We used to describe these dishes by their colors - The Red, the Orange, the White, and The Green ones, respectively.  Of course, there were other dishes, and desserts, but these have always been part of the main course.  The flavors of the dishes are still quite distinct and quite tasty. Nothing seemed overdone, overcooked, or overspiced. And their service is top notch. Their attentiveness to fill our glasses, provide copious amounts of Naan Bread, and clear our table of finishes plates were quite commendable.  The one additional that we did get to experience was the Jalebi. They are rounded, orange, sweet pretzel sticks. They definitely add a great dimension to those that have sweet tooths!  The place definitely has a quiet and relaxed atmosphere, and we never felt rushed to finish or intruded upon during our prolonged conversations.  And as far as a buffet is concerned, this is a great bargain; and a wonderful dining experience for those looking for alternatives to the typical lunch selections.

Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States
