Sdzfy_ZTb9oO5RWlIRVpJQ.text: Fabulous Punjabi cuisine made with a whole lot of loving! As good as my home cooking! Well almost! Ha ha! But seriously go try it!!!!

JUpXURua9FXPrfAlR-0nDQ.text: We come here regularly however, today was just not a great experience. The chicken was overcooked and the dessert balls (gulab jamin) were overcooked, like tasted burnt, and misshapped. Totally dissatisfied.

lHyPPtM961-Sres7R7DSuA.text: So apparently..this is THE ONLY Indian restaurant to serve their entree with NO RICE INCLUDED? I was told  "Family Style" is what they call the tradition of serving their food without rice included. I feel terrible for the family of the owners of Indian Delhi Palace, if they do not get rice served with their food.   To be fully honest, the food had very little to no flavor at all. Tasted like Indian food out of a frozen meal package purchased from the grocery store.   TERRIBLE service. TERRIBLE food.   Will not return. Will not recommend to anyone.  C- restaurant.. Foodcourt quality food

V7RNiuKge4Hi2783hshHsQ.text: Lunch buffet: Very tasty food! Good varieties for the price. Unlimited nang bread (the best I've ever had).   I would try to come for dinner next time.

EZXcejQ_YA6eclH8eKvfTw.text: Lunch buffet review: There are plenty of options on the buffet line, not like a Chinese restaurant though, where it might take 30 minutes going to multiple islands of food. Here there is just one island, but the options were great, and you won't go away hungry. I tried a little bit of everything and then went back for my favorites (don't ask me to name them, just go with my strategy of eating a little of everything on the first pass through the buffet).  Pleasant staff, who also brought the naan (why does naan always taste soooo good?). I enjoyed my experience here and would definitely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch buffet=first plate of food.

Ckkp-ORy-1ZMJbdbWsNdKg.text: Ordered Tikka Masala and Saag Paneer for pickup. Also ordered rice and naan. When I got back home, no rice. Instead 2 naan charged $4!  Outrageous!  Food tasted bland:  Saag paneer was supposed to be medium spiciness, not even close. Asked for tikka masala to be mild but was instead spicy. Obviously this establishment doesn't take customer orders seriously. Not ordering from them again.

OfkY-tJXv06ZvVWzl04eUA.text: Dropped by for the weekend lunch buffet (I have been here twice now for the lunch buffet). The decor inside is nice, so it is good for both casual and less formal events. The service is also attentive and will continue to refill drinks and replace empty dishes. The complimentary naan that comes with the lunch is great and is replenished often (I tend to eat a lot of naan and they were very accommodating). My favorite dish is the chicken tikka masala, which has great flavor and the meat itself is cooked tenderly.    One con that really stood out to me was the lack of variety. Although the flavors and tastes of the available entrees were great, there wasn't much room for different types of food. I would estimate that there are 4 meats (the most recent time I went, there were only 2 chicken dishes and 2 lamb dishes) and maybe 4 vegetarian options. Unlike other Indian buffets, there was also only regular white rice (briyani).   Aside from the lower amount of entrees, the food and service was great. I will be back for more of the delicious chicken tikka masala.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch buffet
Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch buffet

fEQpTRbzdwgIUn7Okxx6TA.text: Ordered take-out from here on Ubereats.  Was disappointed to find that the entrees did not come with rice, so we ended up having to make our own rice.  We had ordered naan, but we also like to eat the curries with rice.  Also we selected spice level of 5 out of 10 for both our entrees, but one entree was extremely spicier than the other.    The samosas were good and I enjoyed the green dipping sauce.  The saag was very good.

AxHFFWVwWxJYhfGE6pfZYA.text: We came for the lunch buffet today, and after eating here, I'm pretty sure I'll skip breakfast before I come next time.  There's a huge selection of different curries served at lunch, with both vegetarian and meaty options.  The naan brought to our table was buttery and delicious, and the curries had great flavor.  My favorite of the lunch buffet items was the ground lamb with peas... don't skip that one!    Also, you know you're at an authentic, good-quality place when the table next to you is filled with twenty Indians and there are six cute little kids sprinting around the tables.  :)  We'll definitely be back, and I'll likely fail at stopping myself from eating three plates again.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch buffet- not even including dessert!

kXUvyuj5vJBEkjlRmXf3-g.text: Ordered shrimp tikka, but received fish. I don't mind fish, but I'm very picky with the type of fish I consume. Also ordered sheesh kabob. It was so dry and super salty! I called and had to leave a message, because the message said he was busy serving other customers. Guess what? No call back! I'll never order from here.

bbjoufcjvOcoqP_PWFsBAQ.text: Was visiting Arizona from out of state and found out my friend, a Tucson native, had never tried Indian food. Thankfully this place was super close to the airport and we had time to grab dinner before I left!   It was amazing and the perfect example of what great Indian food is like. The service was friendly and quick without feeling rushed (efficient is probably the word I'm looking for), and the paneer pakora were AMAZING.

T92fZjGCBlfzPvR2hcvR3Q.text: Before I even got a glass of water one of the waiters was extremely rude and not friendly in the slightest, horrible horrible service. I got their after my friends and instead of accommodating us by just putting two tables together he made two of my friends who were already seated to get up and move. Also the waiter made a very snarky comment saying, "we have a party of 6 coming at 6:30pm" and it was 4pm. I do not recommend this place if you're looking for some common courtesy and kindness.

EVcrmqF1sdDOR23tmgrBQw.text: The people were friendly however, the food was not so great. I got the chicken tikka masala with rice, garlic naan and their yogurt salad. I've had this before other places and it does not taste like that. I wasn't a fan of it. Also the service was extremely slow. We weren't too happy with the food or service but like I said the people were really nice!

9z3HITkOIU8J5qV0hitZ3w.text: I never thought the day would come when I'd call Indian food "bland."  I have only been to Indian Delhi Palace a few times and never have I been impressed.  The environment seemed clean and the decor was nice, the service was mediocre and the food was edible, but there was nothing impressive about the visit. The dishes were of low value- relatively high priced for what was included.  We thought that for the price, it was bound to be delicious.     Unfortunately this was not the case.  An $11 entree didn't even include rice or naan, so we paid $3.5 extra for a small bowl of rice.  The $21 combo dinner did include rice and naan, but when the best part of the combo is the raita, something is wrong.   I have never known Indian food to be bland, but that's exactly what I experienced here.  I don't like leaving negative reviews, but this one earned it.

YBQs0PwYETbBKBsbqnChIQ.text: Yum! Delicious food. Had mine delivered and was very happy! Hot fresh and tasty!!! Highly recommend!! The bread is amazing! Tikka masala is great ! My husband has never tried before and loved it. Will order again! Thanks for the delicious Dinner!

xxm7vU9eHPVI-o0WV5hNQg.text: I have high expectations for Indian food, given I've grown up eating it. I read a few negative reviews and noticed many of them all complained that the food was too spicy. You should really specify your heat tolerance when ordering, because the food here is spicier than at any other Indian restaurant I've been to in the Valley. But no complaints from here, I love spicy food! We came in a group for a birthday, and everybody loved what they ordered. The dinner combo is massive. I can't believe it's listed as dinner for one. I had the samosa chaat. I was very impressed. They were very generous with the chutney (which makes all the difference in chaat). My friend had been craving shahi paneer for months and said this place did not disappoint. What really impressed me was the dishes that the food was served in. My mango lassi tasted great in the authentic cup it was served in (see pic). Altogether, we had appetizers, main courses, a combo meal, and dessert and there were no complaints in the group. Generous portions and great environment! I am going to make this place my regular spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. samosa chaat &amp; mango lassi

qXoQH1obtm8Q7IFLtBticQ.text: Excellent food and service. Of you have never had Indian food try the set meal options for a tests of multiple dishes. We ordered and ate family style so had 4 dishes plus rice and Nan bread. Kima Nan is our favorite. Great taste which is why we go back repeatedly.

QfYCi3pdsY_ZDWSw3ffm9g.text: I've been here a few times for their lunch buffet. The food is good... pretty standard for Indian. Today I went with 4 coworkers and they charged us an additional 18% gratuity for a large party. First, a party of 5 is too small to incur the automatic 18% gratuity; it's 6 or 8 at most restaurants. Second, the 18% was added on for the lunch buffet. I wouldn't have minded as much if it was waited service since I usually tip that much anyway. However, a mandatory 18% for a lunch buffet for 5 people is ludicrous. There are plenty of Indian places around here that are just as good, if not better, and I will be patronizing them instead.

yES_gx52Na6fldmwmFrkbQ.text: Let me just preface this review by saying that it does pain me to write a negative review about almost any establishment in the valley.  Unfortunately for India Delhi, it has to be done.  Honestly, I have not dined inside this restaurant, my experience is purely from multiple take out orders over the past year.  Living in Arcadia and loving food as I do, I am lucky in the fact that I do not have to travel far to enjoy ethnic culinary delights that other cultures have to offer.  If your a foodie in the 21st century, Indian food is all over your radar.  India Delhi, found at 54th street and McDowell in Phoenix, fits the bill of almost every other Indian restaurant in the valley. Nice external building, clean looking restaurant and the normal tinctures related to that region of the world.    Always friendly and eager to take your order, the young gentleman at the front counter has never let me down in taking care of my to go order. Always checking each container to make sure it has the correct contents, etc.  On the Saturday I am referencing for this review, the young man was not there, but the owner and his wife were. In my opinion, Indian food is not a cheap venture. I always find myself wanting to try a dish as well as getting a staple that I know is going to be solid. When you add in the extra charge for rice(never included), yogurt sauce(not included), etc, the bill for myself and companion always tops $40.  I usually do not gripe as I know the quality will be there and I just love the food, what can I say.  On this Saturday though, something was different. This was evident from the moment I walked in the door, I could not put my finger on it, but something was just not vibing.  The owners wife(or co owner for all I know) was at the counter and asked if I wanted the buffet. I politely turned it down as I am not a fan of buffet food, especially with Indian cuisine.  I politely turned that down and proceeded to order tandoori chicken, saag paneer, chicken biryani, basmati rice and some naan.    What happened next is not something I will forget soon.  I watched as the owner walked out of the kitchen with the pan in hands and used the spinach for my saag paneer from the buffet.  The owners and my eyes met as he processed that I saw what he was doing.  In that moment, the owner sold and gave up all his culinary credibility. He proceeded to head back to the kitchen to use said items.    I waited for another fifteen minutes and took my order home.  What did I find? The chicken biryani, the only item I might add not in the buffet, was extremely hot, almost too hot to touch.  The saag paneer was warm at best. The tandoori chicken was a collection of small legs(customary for Indian buffets) and once again, not hot.  I knew what had happened and could not help feeling beyond annoyed with the situation.   Normally, I just deal with what is, I do not ever send food back and especially on to-go orders.  This time was different, I could not let it go.  I called the restaurant and without pause the owner got on, knowing exactly who I was and what the problem was. He put up a fight for around 20 seconds saying that he just used the spinach as a base for the saag paneer and what not, but then finally just apologized and said he would "make it right."    I do not really see myself going back here, but who knows.  This is a good excuse to venture out and try some more of the valleys offerings in this arena.

t5iOWp7mWRjXg-yDJNoFNw.text: Quite pricey. I got the Tandori chicken and thought it was a meal (as most Indian places service it with rice or other sides).  But here, it was 4 pieces of chicken, and they weren't even whole pieces.  Like the breast was cut in half and counted as two pieces. Quite odd. And it was pricey for 4 "pieces" of chicken. First went here with a Groupon type deal.  Only go again because it is halfway to my friend's house and we meet up.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Krp2NOLvM8e0HB8nMzBuvQ.text: Just moved to this area and tried this place for the first time. Lovely, attentive staff and nice interior. The food was amazing. We had samosas, chicken tikki masala, curry shrimp and garlic naan. I can't wait to go back and try more dishes. A little pricey (never had to order rice seperately) but worth it.

n24WCWBy7qAf2-JAmz2YIA.text: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in the Phoenix area. They have a grocery on the side and they are obviously very authentic. Their veggie koorma, chicken curries, and tandoori are excellent and all served with their lunch buffet, along with their superb naan.  The buffet is probably the best buffet I've ever had, since they are usually populated with cheap meats, and mass produced sauces. This place is excellent, and every dish oozes real Indian spice and care.    Very highly recommended, though I've only tried them for lunch and don't know how and if their dinner would be different.

Y-x6mxyMTcPcZ8Fisk03-Q.text: Amazing! Extremely friendly staff. The chicken curry, naan, sweet red honey balls and bread pudding were incredible.

48FupXk7zFzlvuviJf5M9w.text: Still as good as it has been for the two decades that I have been going to Indian Delhi Palace.

EEeH5svJREVlvHabETS39w.text: Very good food. We orders the butter chicken and tandori chicken. Only thing you may consider is to go spicy. I went med and it was not spicy enough for me.

RgwwPj_4sOlfsyqngQMPog.text: My boss is Indian and we decided to try and find a good Indian restaurant while in Az. We loved this place. We went back twice! Delicious food and wonderful service.  They have a facebook page with coupons.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UPmWvWQk-yC0RXCAf6-4rA.text: Tongue is dancing in delight as my cravings have been satisfied with perfectly seasoned spiciness.

F6Dkltz6yrjOT76OlPSoiQ.text: They did not make a great first impression and I don't think I will be back.  I took some friends to try Indian food for the first time. The service was not good at all. We had to go to the kitchen to get service for our drink orders. My friends enjoyed the food although I have had better.  But the naan was good.

pMsuIC7kcLNfCeVx5o7f7Q.text: The best Indian food in the valley hands down. Every time I go it nothing but the best, food service and price! The never skimp on spices like the other places do and everything is always just how you order it (mild, medium , spicy). I have been to England and India and this place is closest I have found. If India is a 10 this place is a 9.5!! Just go and make sure you have some mango ice cream for desert (it's unlike any you have ever had).

a-fiJivsRySxdJBiDUxI9g.text: Our entrees didn't seem freshly prepared, especially my Chana Masala that looked like some dry, clustered up entree leftover from a lunch buffet.  I've never seen Chana Masala lump up like that unless it was my leftovers at home.  Garlic naan was average.  Prices were reasonable, but EXCLUDED rice.  Restrooms were deplorable.  Not sure I'll be back again anytime soon.

1MRyUtQRgjW6Ox53h-4cdw.text: Really nice indian. Location could be better, but that's just nit picking. Delicious food, hot is important, service adequate.But again GOOD FOOD.

Ht9WBzP5gojRIJNIbq5EZA.text: Went to Phoenix today visiting our son.  One of our favorite things to do is to find new Ethnic Restaurants.  We had some chores to do in and around Scottsdale and were craving some good Indian lunch Buffet.  We had heard about this place being a tasty and reasonable place to eat.  Funny, we got there fairly early even before noon on a Friday and the parking lot was full.  A good sign.  We walked into a beautifully appointed clean place with white table cloths, red napkins and that was another pleasant surprise The price for the buffet is $8.95 per person and well worth that. They were constantly filling up the trays.    The salad was crispy lettuce, tomatoes with an assortment of Indian dressings, a chutney, and some other wonderful dressing.  The chick pea salad was so good that I devoured 2 plates of that.  They also had a large bowl of what looked to be taco chips.  However, they were homemade and so crunchy with Indian flavoring.  I could have just eaten that alone.  I was pretty stuffed at this point.  The main dishes were Tandoori chicken, Curry chicken with a great sauce.  Another curry dish with potatoes and onions.   Of course rice and paneer which was also yummy.  A couple of simosa fritters which were a little tough but was still tasty.  Three different deserts.  Rice pudding was great to take the bite out of some of the moderately spicy  dishes.  Also a carrot pudding which if your'e Jewish reminded me of Tsimis. Not sure how to spell it.    There was also like a sponge cake ball fried crispy.  I just threw that into the rice pudding to end the meal.  The place was packed by the time we left about 1.30PM or so.  Lots of business people enjoying some heavenly treats.  Good price, good service.  What more can one ask for. No dinner for me tonight.

a8pzxIpy_na_lyXtOJFHSA.text: Finding good Indian food in Phoenix has made the move here easier...especially a place that's a mile from my house.  Parking is easy Service is always fantastic Take-out is always ready very quickly and very hot Good variety of spices at the attached little store  Tried and recommend: Shahi paneer, chicken tikka masala, veg korma. chana masala Might revisit but not thrilled with initially: saag paneer, aloo gobi  If you like spicy (or not), tell them--they go kinda easy on the hotness unless you specifically ask (use the 1-10 scale)  I wish it was a little less formal feeling inside, but I typically do take-out so not a big deal--it just makes for a date-ish environment rather than a group o' friends environment.  Again, not a bad thing, i'm just sayin'. I've also never checked out the lunch buffet so maybe the white tablecloths and preset water glasses are a PM thing.   [p.s. i'm now officially amused that i just said i wished a place was less nice. don't really hear that too often...]

jd4pV4Jk8P71jR_4lrTiaA.text: Food was absolutely amazing! I got a carafe of cab and the non vegetarian dinner, which comes with a bit of everything. The chicken curry was by far the best curry I've eaten. But in all honesty everything from the naan to the rice to the pistachio ice cream and tea was amazing. I will definitely be back and often since the prices are pretty reasonable. I took one star off because the servers seemed bothered that we were there and weren't entirety helpful when we had questions, one server kept whispering everything then just basically walked away before seeing if we understood. Thankfully my friend was there who is a veteran Indian food eater and explained all the meal items to me.

TllNDMC03auCGuarCP_rfw.text: I'm not biased when I say, humble little joint but great North Indian food. Have been here for years, buffet and dinner and always come out very satisfied with no issues. Remember, it's all about the food here and not the atmosphere although it is clean and friendly. It may be a bit dimly lit at some of the tables or booths but they will rectify it if you bring it to their attention. The owner Anil is always happy to have you back and he'll make sure you are pleased. It's located in a partially vacated strip mall on the southwest corner of 28th drive and Bell Rd. just one light west of the I-17 frwy. You might still have to squint to spot it from your car, on the inside corner of the elbow. Follow your nose once you exit your car,you can't miss it. Take some home...it's always a tad better the next day..besides you're home too!!

geWgQaby0BOB6N57W7nGrg.text: Came here last night with the girlies to satisfy our craving for Indian food.  We've talked about this place for a while, and I'll be damned if I was leaving AZ before stopping by this place!  So luckily, I was able to convince one of the girls that finals are not as important as saying goodbye to me over a plate of curries.  We got their around 8 and the place had a good crowd.  We were the only white girls, so we know we were in for a good meal.  Going over the menu took us a while, because one of the girls had no clue what she wanted, and the server was polite enough to let us take our time.  Before we figured out what we wanted for dinner, of course we had to figure out drinks.  So we all order and still continue to peruse the menu.  Then our drinks came out...huge plus for this place right here, they were huge!  My gin and tonic was in an oversized cocktail glass and my friend's Chardonnay was filled to the brim.  No skimping on alcohol here!  The waiter advised us the drinks were strong, which I was fine with but my girlfriend needed 3 more limes to take hers down.  We finally end up decided on dinner, with the shahih paneer, chicken saag, and vegetable korma, and an order of garlic naan.  I was a little unsure about the paneer, but my girlfriends swore by it.  When the food arrived, we were excited!  Everything smelled so flavorful and the naan was huge, good thing we only got one order.  I loved every single bite I had at dinner, and the feeling was mutual across the table.  All of us ate beyond the point of feeling full, but we couldn't help ourselves!  This food was too good!  Luckily, we were able to stop ourselves and save some food to take home.  I got the chicken saag and I am so excited to have some for my own brunch.  Mmmmm...I'm getting hungry thinking about it now.  Overall, $20 a person including tip, with strong drinks, good food, and extras to take home we were satisfied.

Zdfm8hCdFYSD9xI8ugiPCg.text: Horrible food horrible service. Had something with chicken and the chicken must have been the worst part of a chicken. It was rubbery and nasty. You had to order the rice separately and for lunch it ended up being $18.00. Service was horrible. I would have rather gone to the Subway next door.

oaio9v2SNJT5_ZuBWNzrkw.text: Good spice levels. Chicken tikka masala and samosas were the most popular with our group. Did not enjoy the shrimp curry. Great friendly and helpful service.

QjKBH_YS2TdLEDdZcmgIbg.text: We were here for their lunch buffet. The chicken tendori? was very tender. Coconut dessert was good. Everything was bit too salty.

ucUxavbkKaOodpVuDQ5_zA.text: Everything I've ordered here has been pretty good. My main compliant is that there is a great amount of variability within the same dish depending on the day. This variability includes flavors, texture, spice level and ingredients. Sometimes the dish is fantastic and sometimes it is only OK. We continue to come here because the food is usually pretty good, the turnaround for pick-up orders is quick, there is plenty of parking, the food is moderately priced AND there is nothing near us that is any better (for cost/easy of pickup). Definitively room for improvement here. Additionally, rice does not come with the curries; you are charged 3.50 extra.

YFK2DUK5wpG3Gc43trae6A.text: All I have to say is - I'm a punjabi and I endorse this message.  Portfolio - Chicken Tikka Masala, Chana Masala, Palak Paneer. garnished with courteous service. A gem in the middle of this desert.

1QQEbJdDH4Xw_AjBQ-2VWA.text: Food-Good selection, everything tasted fresh Environment-Very clean and great helpful service  Can't wait to return!

jxE6Tt1afoCete7hh_UWbw.text: 3.5 stars. Ate for the first time here last weekend, and the food was great! I recommend getting one of the complete dinners if you are not familiar with what's good to order. Atmosphere is quiet and decor is a little rough around the edges, but a good place to go for a casual meal. Servers are polite, but come across lackluster in their contribution to your dining experience, although that seems to be a trend at most Indian restaurants reviewed on Yelp. 4 stars: food. 3 stars: atmosphere/service

pTddwikhGh0nEuYPnXUF2Q.text: The worst service ever :( They messed up our food and we complained we go yield at. I will take my money some were else. There are plenty of Indian restaurants in the valley, and you just lost a customer :(

on5DV7xB3t03FrGRt_yNhQ.text: Yes I would say this place is good. Service a little slow maybe but the quality of the food was very good. Nice atmosphere.

VqSPS2mDCtAi8FZfcInTMg.text: The appearance and cleanliness of this place is really nice, however there isn't hardly any variety what so ever for there buffet. There is one table of food and that's it and most of there food was cold and tasted exactly like those canned foods that you buy at the grocery store. Price is outrages for what they offer as I went to golden corral with my spouse, and spent the same amount, exact same and got a ton and I mean a ton of options, and best of all there food tastes great! Sadly I do not and would not recommend this place to anyone. If you are looking for a buffet try golden corral or the mandarin, but don't be lured in by the appearance of this Indian place as you will leave disappointed.

7BDUU_vUY8Hy4a9CscJOPg.text: AWESOME...! The place was clean  Food was great Good selection of food Service was friendly Bathrooms were clean  It doesn't get much better than this

xSpTMwZbVnL_SlTvFLGOOA.text: I was checking the reviews when I saw the yelp coupon and bought it! We ordered: Samosas, Chicken Tikka Masala ($10.99), palak paneer ($8.99-spinach and "cottage cheese"), and goat masala (11.99?).  I'm not a frequenter of Indian cuisine establishments so i can't really compare it to others but the chicken tikka masala was AMAZING! Palak Paneer was also great. The goat masala was good, not gamey at all! They definitely don't clean the bones away very well so be careful not to chip a tooth. Server was not overly friendly but good enough between him and the 2 bussers who were prompt to refill our waters from ordering a little too high on the spicy scale :)  I need to come back for the lunch buffet for $8.99 sometime!

V9b4iFldpgkL8m1COjORig.text: Great, authentic, delicious Indian food.  We are always excited to make the trip over here, knowing we'll get some REAL Indian food.  The samosas, garlic naan, biryani, and lamb korma are among my favorites, and should always be had with a mango lassi.  Ah, perfection.    The only thing that is making me hesitant to give that last star is their lunch buffet.  Not the biggest selection - which wasn't a huge deal... still plenty to eat. The problem was the temperature of everything.  I was seriously afraid that I was going to get food poisoning (I didn't, thank goodness).  This can not be a safe temp to keep food at for more than 10 minutes!  Although, the husband claims that it is pretty much the same at all Indian buffets... you can tell, I usually just order off the menu wherever I go.    Definitely stick to the menu, and your experience will be 5-stars.  Attempt the buffet at your own risk...

aVxJlxX8n_xGvarpRY_gKg.text: Delicious food with consistent quality.  Always pleased with lunch selection but the menu is where this restaurant succeeds.  Deep rich flavored, fresh ingredients and any level of spice you can handle.

UuDTfHpDvdgylLaf4WCyhw.text: Do yourself a favor...NEVER EVER GO THIS PLACE. If you are indian you will regret it. If you are not indian and trying indian food for first time then you will never try indian food in your entire life. I took chicken biriyani to go. It was worst biriyani I ever had. I drove 20 mins keeping the biriyani in passenger seat. Didn't smell anything like biriyani.  It WAS YELLOW RICE WITH SOME BOILED CHICKEN SOME SLICED JALAPENO  AND TOMATO SLICE. Biriyani was $12. They charged  $3 for raita. First time I saw biriyani doesn't come with raita. They gave green and red chutney with the biriyani.  Who the hell eat green chutney with biriyani.  I HAD TO CALL THE RESTAURANT SUGGESTING THE CHEF TO WATCH COUPLE OF YOUTUBE VIDEOS HOW TO MAKE BIRIYANI. Please please don't go this place.

T15zJzEMy4XuLvqfVWGeLg.text: I've always liked this place,  and never *loved* it...     What's not to love about tasty food prepared well for a fair price?   Nothing I guess...     maybe I always come at the wrong time of day or something.    Apparently the owners also run my favorite Indian kitchen in Las Vegas (India Masala) - but the context is different.

fpvIONJ9iPNX13kAQXmABg.text: Seems like they have too much business and are way too busy. I called twice asking to speak to whoever i need to to inquire about holding a party for my upcoming event. Both of the times i was told that i will be called back but they never did. I guess you dont need my business. I will be happy to take it elsewhere.

qWY6u1AGGX5H3dO5JLilBg.text: Had the Sunday buffet which had quite a spread much of which tasted just fine. Three different types of desserts. The samosas were not kept warm which was a bummer. I also should not have to ask to have my water filled or wait some time for plates to be cleared. Service was not as attentive as I would like but the food was pretty good.

g6SOpYHW5Lf_mxOOBxLoeQ.text: The service and food here is ALWAYS really amazing! My family and I love the lunch buffet. The place is always spotless. The dining room has a fine dining feel, but contrary to fine dining the staff is seen but not heard. Which I love. They clean your dirty dishes away as soon as you're finished with your plate no matter how packed the place seems.   I always go back for thirds because the food is so good and fresh and hot and wonderful. :-) Thank you Indian Delhi Palace!!!!

9Aj1dPPS7bc2Vy3Eptv2nQ.text: I was really looking forward to this meal but it was down hill from the beginning. I got the bag from my Uber driver and it smelled delicious! When I got to my hotel room their was no utensils despite this being a delivery (to go) order. No big deal, I went back downstairs to get utensils from the bar. As soon as I opened my rice and took my first bite it was bit after bite of bone particles. When I dug to the bottom there was no goat meat but more large bones. Also, I LOVE spicy food but the heat on this rice was WAY to spicy so the flavor was lost. Terrible experience and will not get repeat service from me or my colleagues.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of many bones in my goat biryani.

utVlRfDeAQwBPFxoBZ2kzw.text: If you go with someone who knows them you will be in good hands.  However their takeout is definitely lacking.  Difficult to place your order.

vRkOw4iOeIxD7JEn5RuCYQ.text: I've basically gotten through the Indian lunch buffets in the Phoenix metropolitan area so now I'm trying out different places for take-out; I got take-out from here today and it was so positive an experience I wanted to change my review from 4 to 5 stars.   I got malai kofta, palak (no paneer), veg korma, papadum, and plain naan. I was really excited honestly b/c I haven't seen papadum on many restaurants' options for ordering takeout online and I love papadum. $1 gets you two full circles which seems, extremely reasonable. I did not get rice b/c I had some basmati left over but I'm sure it would have been fine and proportionately priced.   I just liked every step of the experience. You can order online through their website in a way that is very straight-forward, and which lets you specify what spice level you want, from 1-10. I was in the mood for mild food, so I just went 2-3 and I'll tell you what - that food was definitely a 2-3/10, with just the barest touch of spice.   I got a text confirming they'd received my order, and then a text when it was ready - which took only like 20 minutes? You pay when you pick it up so there's no chance of paying and then not receiving food or your order not having been processed. Also, I've been here a couple times now and the same guy's been at the counter each time, and he has a real friendly energy.   And the food is really good! I don't think this will be one of my buffet staples, but that's just b/c I'm a weird guy w/ really specific, esoteric preferences in dining rooms, and not at all a reflection on the quality of the restaurant itself.  Also, the pick-up/take-out order was packaged mostly with (potentially) reusable stuff - the three entrees were in reusable plastic containers (the same kind like, soup always comes in from East Asian takeout places) and the whole order was in a white paper gift bag instead of a plastic bag. The only un-reusable things were the foil the naan came in and the wrap around the papadum, and maybe the plastic containers with chutney. I don't fault any place for using disposable materials - I don't know a LOT about running a restaurant, but I know the profit margins are often really slim - but do like getting food in reusable containers/bags.

k88quKLhUvwpCAbEEmzSWw.text: Oh my god . I can not understand why they using the cat food container for their customer . I can not stop myself from laughing when they serving the curry chicken and whatever the lamp meal is . It was terrible experience that i had for the first time to try . The rice does not come with the entree and it cost 3.50 dollars to get one side order , we just spend 70 dollars including tips for couple of really small entrees , i will be definately never come back to this place cause i am so disappointed with everything .

P8HOdcwYe7JR8lP3LS_yUg.text: Wasn't super impressed with this place. I am a huge wimp when it comes to spice so while the average person may not have thought it was spicy - I went through like 5 glasses of water. If you're a wimp like me, this isn't the place for you.   Their chicken tikka masala was too spicy for me. And they used way too much cilantro. I can't tell you how many times I took a bite and I huge thing of cilantro. And I don't think the cilantro was cooked properly or something because it was too bulky and crunchy. Odd texture for a masala that is typically smooth and creamy.   Their fish tandoori had a good flavor but the spice hit me really quickly. I thought it was a bit over cooked and rubbery.   I don't think I'll be coming back here. The service was quick since it was a buffet and they were on spot with refills. It was cheap which was nice. But for someone who is on a low salt diet and wants to treat herself when her water retention is down, this wouldn't be my first choice at all.

4xa-VtRDNLaxV5MVooeUmw.text: I have a love/ hate relationship with this restaurant where take away is concerned but the lunch buffet has taken me by surprise.  This review is for the Buffet Lunch which is priced at $13  Naan, Rice, Goat curry, Goat keema, chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, fish tikka, Saag curry, mix vegetable, veg fritters, salad bar, kheer, gulab jamun, mango custard. (that's all I can remember)  Buffet typically has these options.   The taste and quality have been consistently good. Fresh Naan bread is brought to the table. The restaurant has great ambience. Service is quick and attentive.  I definitely recommend the lunch buffet it's one of the best in the valley. Only thing I would say is the dessert section could use some improvement.  Cheers!

AQCDmxE2Z_fH18R1BpIIgA.text: I used to live in the 'arcadia lite' area. I regularly dined at Delhi Palace from 03'-09'. I credit the establishment to have played an instrumental role in opening my 'food mind'.  I began my journey at the buffet line, enjoying the typicals like chix saag, chix tikka, saag paneer, vindaloo, kheema mattar. I found the dishes so damn enjoyable, I never felt the need to stray too far from the basics, and generally ordered the same thing. I'm sorry to report after today's lunch visit, it appears that Delhi Palace has had some changes. I selected chix tikka, saag, and tandoori chix. Formally, I recall the chix tika masala as being- creamy, buttery, and the slightly sweet tomatoe flavor was always evident, all wraped up in a blend of delish indian spice. I recall stand out flavors being garam masala and curry. The consistency of the sauce was thick yet, pour-able. Today the lite creamy/buttery slightly sweet tomatoe flavor was absent. I tasted heavy smoke flavor, cayenne and the predominant spice i noted was salt. I would describe the sauce as paste. The flavor seemed...soooo concentrated. The saag, also very salty and spice flavor seemed concentrated..... I'm not sure what happened to the recipes  of yester-year, but it was dissapointing.

yn0LjNC8aAIB_ipNQzQJqw.text: Got an order to go about a half hour before they closed. They are one of the later Indian places to be open. We got samosas, naan bread with mint and tamarind chutney, butter chicken and chicken vindaloo. Plus we got raita and mango lassi. They were very quick and kept well in the car ride. A little disappointed we only got 1 rice container for the 2 orders, but everything tasted good. Would go back again.

zaPoXVfmFvvZh5WZO4Sj3A.text: Gross. I think this is one of those places where suburban white people eat and then they think it's good? There are so many better places in Phoenix.  I mean the carrots came out of either a can or a bag of frozen vegetables and everything is so bland.   The reason why Indian food is normally expensive is because the spices are expensive, and they spend time creating their dishes. Here, they're putting very little effort into their food with very little good ingredients and still charging the same that other places do.   Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. And do yourself another favor, scroll to the bottom of any Yelp review and click not recommended reviews. If you notice most of those reviews are from people who know what they're talking about. I'm not going to take advice from somebody who thinks Panda Express is real Chinese food.  Anyway it's not the worst thing I've ever eaten in my life but in terms of Indian food it's definitely at the bottom.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apparently, Korma has mushrooms? There were no cashews, no golden raisins, but mushrooms. Sure, okay...

Qn7ZL9UOeWBCimp2JI1H2Q.text: I am addicted to Indian food. Whenever I step into an Indian restaurant my salivary glands go into overdrive.  This was my second visit to this establishment and the second visit topped the first. Why, you say?  The difference was defined by the a la carte experience as opposed to the buffet experience. Please note, there was absolutely nothing wrong with the buffet as it contained all the requisite flavors that make an Indian meal so delicious (although I did leave feeling like a stuffed turkey!).  However, at dinner, you can order exactly what you want off the menu, you can savor the precise flavors that you want. You can order garlic naan if you want. You can have a lamb vindaloo as spicy as you want. You can decide on chicken or lamb or shrimp or simply go vegetarian.   The decor here is typical of an Indian restaurant. The TV is set to play Indian songs, some of which you may recognize. The waiters are polite. The drinks are reasonably priced. Our overall dining experience was excellent. This place deserves a visit. We shall return.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A culinary feast.

goCgpqZcQbXVU4Utm_BB2Q.text: I just ordered this place on Uber Eats.  I've also been in for the lunch buffet before as well. Anyways as I'm ordering it has an add on option for each entree.  Basmati rice is an add on for $3.50.  I assume that is if you want extra because literally every other Indian restaurant I've eaten at in my life includes rice with entrees.  Well my delivery just came and now I have 3 entrees with no rice.  What a freaking joke.  I will never order from or go into this place again.

0pC51ltsUkwbJWFNXCNF_g.text: I've tried a lot of Indian places in the valley - some have been okay and some not so good. My husband and I saw this on check please and we've been wanting to come try it.  Best Indian place we've been to so far! We did the buffet - I still don't know what to order.  Amazing! Definitely worth the drive (from Gilbert) and coming back for sure!  Friendly staff, nice music, and very clean!

ATVFodc__P1ZoIThAh5Ixw.text: We went to try their weekday lunch buffet. The buffet timing is until 4:30 usually most places close the buffets by 2:30 so that was great. The only thing I would like to improve is having more options for the buffet but the quality and taste of the food is exceptional. Everything tasted amazing. The price was great too.

dRjzklAlxwpBA29mlcokAw.text: Food was good but the service was so slow. I won't go back. 1 woman, 1 young man seem to be the only ones working. There was no crowd, no multiple tables. Only one other table occupied by a couple. In my opinion I shouldn't have to wait 12 mins just to put in my order. I had to ask for the bill twice.  Waited another 10 minutes before she brings back my credit card. Not the best first impression.

vOn2dQucYoYtgKa1L0Yphg.text: The food is delicious, but the prices are WAY TOO HIGH for the small portion sizes. I feel robbed when I spend $50 on dinner for two people and probably $7 of that was their actual food cost, if that. Look at it this way... for $10 you get their lunch buffet that has naan, rice and an assortment of foods (all you can eat). But when you order food to go, they charge for every single item... $10 for each entry, $2.5 for naan, $3 for rice, etc. It adds up quick and all of that is at cheap cost for them, so their margins are huge! It's a ripoff, but the food is -like I said- delicious.

Ycrkzd9nW0JqXtr5l9bqzw.text: After all the issues we've had finding food sushi in Phoenix, I was worried about beginning to Indian food venues.  Luckily, we were much more successful with this type of food. The Indian Delhi Palace was absolutely scrumptious, and just as awesome, it was incredibly affordable.  The Samosas were perfectly sized and scrumptious.  I wish that they'd brought the tamarind sauce out before them with the chutney, but it did go perfectly with the samosa.  I got Malai Kofta.  Not exactly what I was expecting (it's my favorite dish), as it was a bit different than other places I've had it, but it was still delicious.  My partner got a good ol' favorite; Saag Paneer. It was a bit too spicy for her (her fault for ordering it medium), but we wound up mixing the two sauces together, and it was perfect. Portions were generous, especially given the affordable prices.  The service was so-so; our glasses stayed empty for some time before they got refills.  I wish I'd gotten a mango lassi, but it was a bit pricey, and we chose the Samosas instead. Also, I was a bit disappointed that the naan was sold separately, but I guess that's the way lots of places are going now.  All told, it was delicious, comforting and satisfying Indian food, and we were quite impressed! I can't wait to try their lunch buffet.

NQB19LY-Re956LtvIcNFZA.text: Big bunch of family over so we created our own buffet!  Shrimp biryani, veggie biryani, tandoori shrimp and tandoori chicken, chicken tikka masala, palak paneer, samosas, raita, and lots of naan (plain, cheese and garlic).  Everyone loved the chicken...which I don't eat, but others said it was good.  I loved both biryanis and the paneer with raita over it.  I also loved the naan dipped in masala sauce! SO glad it's close to home!

rOmQriQ9QElJl8oJFkeNUg.text: This is an excellent Indian Restraunt serving northern Indian food. Lived in Nyc and San Francisco and their food is comparable to those cities. We've tried other Indian Restraunts all over Phoenix and this one stands out as the best. Also has very attentive and excellent service.

igzuOPIS-kS1Ny_4wn1xGQ.text: Had the lunch buffet today. I've been here before but it's been a few years.   The naan was excellent. Some of the best I've had. Really thin with plenty of ghee on top.   The tandoori chicken was likewise some of the best I've had from a buffet.   If there is anything bad to say about my visit, there wasn't quite enough variety. There were 3 different chicken dishes but no lamb, otherwise I'd give them 5 stars.

ezzTJmDSzYL6tICq-z3fOw.text: Great food. Buffet was tasty. Packed as soon as they opened. Restaurant has authentic feel. Will definitely be back.

jguQ5Ueu5DHnosMkpkFEbQ.text: Fantastic Chicken tikka masala and garlic naan!  Gulab jamun is good, but not the best I've had.  I didn't like the palak paneer.    Service is friendly and efficient.  Preparation of food can take awhile, so don't arrive starving.  Lunch buffet available, and you can even take lunch buffet to-go!  (Haven't tried it, yet though so I can't vouch for the food served.)  Ooh, I've got to get this on my rotation soon!

oiEMYhdQLolIkm0uu01YkA.text: B day party here Sunday buffet and they really tended to our table. We never had to wait for refills or naan they kept our table clear. The food is the best in town and I'll be back soon.

C9wqo_Z8KwVQPx_ch-dOfg.text: Had Shrimp biriyani and that was horrible. Raita was not served and when asked 'so called raita' was given and was worst i ever had. Kabab was also bad.

BoRGbV-e9Afn8YTNTL9xaw.text: Cockroach on table (and a neighboring table). Lamb super mealy. Wine bottle "opened" in back and then brought to table with cork from another bottle. No apologies. Just arguments. You've been warned.

Obpqeyd_uxmY5p9UV_vpwA.text: It is an ok indian restaurant, the quality is not vwry low but it is alao not high at all

q-lfYkvbEUliJwL9xmU62A.text: I'm not a huge fan of Indian food, but I do believe that's because I was probably eating at bad places. This place has converted me! I had the Lamb Korma and my hubby had the Butter Chicken. Everything was very flavorful! The establishment is very clean and very authentic. Our service lacked, slow and didn't ask us for drinks etc, but they were very friendly regardless. We will definitely be going back to try more!

W6uNX6HEtQlJ3kA3qpmZFg.text: Excellent service, beautiful atmosphere, and the best indian food in Phoenix. Highly recommended!

aPSUkYj7jWJuIFOvCdFSFg.text: I live in a restaurant desert and had been craving Indian for about four months. This totally hit the spot. We started with one of each of the selection of for Indian beers.  Then, we got tandoori chicken, which was cooked and seasoned to perfection. The Tikka Masala was also full of flavor. My husband had the shrimp vindaloo and said it was solid...not mind blowing, but good.  Aloo Gobi turned out to be a bit small for a main course and a bit dry. But that was the only disappointment. I was also surprised by the gratuity being included for four adults and three small children....but I guess the small people in our party are people too. A party of six is a party of six ....even if they are toddlers.  Side note, said toddlers broke a vase in the bathroom and I told the server to charge us for that, but he didn't. We added quite a bit more to his tip so he can choose to replace the vase or live with karma. :) I'm just happy to have Indian in my belly.

A_Giwtj2gK-7C6paTD_RMw.text: I don't understand the low rating for this restaurant.   - Great ambiance relative to the numerous other Indian restaurants I have been to.  - Good service, water was refilled 3 times, naan was replaced immediately upon decimation.   - PRICE. With the yelp deal its incredibly cost effective to get full off of good indian food.   - The food was good, not great, not bad, but good.   Of course I always compare a meal relative to how much I paid. I paid $5 dollars for AYCE indian food that had a decent selection of food, all of which was delicious. For 5 bucks this place is as good as it gets.   Always review relative to how much you paid. If you rate this place any less than 3 stars you are truly a snob.

PyY703Ifz3HNF2nkp6nNAA.text: Delicious. I loved the chicken tika masala and the garlic naan. The service was really good as well. Definitely will be back soon.

oPlPPakZDbQoFSr5W0JLng.text: Food here is great. I have been there several times already and am always satisfied. Seating is very nice. Area is clean and well decorated. Staff are friendly and polite. The outside isn't the greatest looking, however don't be fooled by the way the outside looks. Went on a date here and she seemed impressed once we were inside. I would recommend this spot for sure.

0f0Srx5u47cZHOI7mxI5pw.text: Uh-May-Zing  This was my first time eating Indian food and I am now a new  fan of it! My cousin who loves Indian food and was visiting from LA said it was the best Indian food she has ever had! The location is cool because they give you a taste of the Indian style and culture from the moment you enter the parking lot where the building has a palace shape and their is a cool looking mural on the large wall. The inside is pretty nice and the Indian cultural theme continued here with a homely feel because it is owned by one family it seemed. The chicken masala I ordered was impeccable and just my taste at a level 6 spiciness and the garlic naan was mouthwatering with the yogurt dipping sauce. The place is pretty nice but there's no need to overdress here. Best part was that they offered a 15% Yelp check in discount! Also, they have an attached spice shop if you are interested.

3SG_xNwtmnYZKZQytpvxLg.text: after a hard day of racing go karts at octane, we stopped in here for a lunch break.   it is sunday and they have a buffet for 10 bucks. i was quite impressed with the buffet offerings. there is chikpea salad (ok, not great), about 6 curry meat options, and 4 curry vegetable offerings along with the basmati rice, and 2 desert options.   i enjoyed all the veggie options. the curries were thick and full of lentils/spinach/potatoe, etc. the rice was fluffy, despite being in a buffet. even the pudding desert dish, with cashews and raisins was tasty. a bit sweet, but good.   there are about 6 chutneys and sauces to compliment your dish if you choose. i always like the yogurt ones. the achar was way too salty for me. our indian guest was well pleased and we took that as a good sign.   they passed the water glass test with flying colors. very formal interiors and the staff was quiet, yet polite and professional. a great dining spot for curry lovers. i have eaten off the menu before and thoroughly enjoyed it as well.

TOGAH-600yj3Uq48bbCxiQ.text: This place was phenomenal, the food was amazing. They catered to me which was amazing. I can't handle spicy food and they took that into great consideration when I asked what they had that was not only low on spiciness but also vegetarian. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal there.

uZzLVHkEuS4lp7JN7LEUrA.text: For the longest time I've always though this had a connection with the Delhi Palace in Tempe , which I think is mediocre, and so I didn't try this location. Finally found out it's not the same so I gave it a try.  Our group went for dinner so everything was ordered by entree. Best thing I tried was the lamb karahi (7/10 spice level) - perfectly cooked and soft meat and the sauce had a great texture with the tomatoes and bell pepper (sweet and satisfying spice level).   The chicken tikka masala (6/10 spice level) also hit the spot. I've only really full on enjoyed tikka masala from one other place and this comes pretty. The tomato base is perfect. The sauce is pureed and sifted until smooth. It was creamier than most chicken tikka masala but it does go well with their ingredients.  The butter chicken was alright. It was enjoyable but glad I shared it because I probably wouldn't have been satisfied if it was the only flavors I tasted.  Green and tamarind chutney are both great. Naan was soft and doughy. Rice was cooked to the right texture.   As far as spice level goes, I think 7 is very satisfying. It does build up as you eat but it's not too spicy in any mean. I would say once you get to an 8 it's closer to eating Serrano and would get that next time I come back.  Just wish the portions were bigger for the price point!

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best Lamb Karahi

sa3Xat9sMXudaBG-OHWt9A.text: Probably my favorite indian restaurant in AZ.  Not only is the food out of this world crazy good, the staff is extra helpful.  This rating is a little late...sorry!! I had my husband's birthday here and they made it extra special.  My spouse and i went there for date night and the host picked up on this.  He sat us at the best table.  It was quiet and the service was awesome. Our business was welcome and appreciated.   This easily is now my go to place for Indian Food.

CjWuOaaXSYgCtN0OYxEkOw.text: Highly recommend.  Lunch buffet is reliable. Service is quick and good. Hot food. Good variety. Meat and vegitarian options. They provide hot and ready naan when you arrive. Parking is self, small but I've never had an issue.  They stay pretty busy but since it's lunch buffet it's quick. Never had to wait.  One of our favorite lunch buffet!

JaQifUNGNBN_egOiWJdqGA.text: Very bad food. I ordered Dum Aaloo and the potatoes, which I guess is the pretty basic ingredient for this dish were uncooked. Very disappointing.

UpKLy0iMg5daJ2o541GPNg.text: Came here on a Saturday and surprisingly it was not overcrowded.  We were seating promptly without menus.  We waited and waited and watched as a young man went to and fro in the dining area. Still no menus. He then began to clear a table of four who had just left  my husband and i asked each other whether it was more important to get  us menus or to clear off a table when no one was waiting for it.  I got up and went to the host at the entrance of the restaurant. He apologized and brought us ONE menu. He told us that they ran out of menus so we had to share one menu.   We were seated opposite each other so we took turns with the menu.  Then we had to flag down the waiter to place an order. Another wait.  I ordered the chicken vindaloo which has potatoes in it. Well the potatoes were raw. Enough that a fork could not go into them. The sauce was nicely spiced. We also ordered chicken biryani which was just ok but at least it wasn't greasy.  Basically this restaurant is in need of severe customer service intervention not to mention a few extra menus.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken vindaloo.
Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The ONE menu that was given to us to share.

3T0OLovBgD1v7Cs7mSI4Kg.text: It was very good looking and aesthetically pleasing to go inside and also continued to be the same inside this restaurant.   Also, the menu looked very good.hence we ordered chicken curry and 2 different parathas and also a garlic naan.  The parathas were a bit bland and especially the Alok one was tasteless, the naans were of the same state.. and not to forget their curry didn't have salt. Overall it was not a pleasant experience at this place from start to the end.. we ordered a dessert - gajar ka Halwa which was plush and definitely won't return to this place again

01t0fhoYSeXacldGMDvSOw.text: Excellent food, great service, easy to get in and out quickly when you are in the middle of a busy workday.

Qvn1cLcWFbM75PEKuE6aSA.text: The make it as spicy as you want it.  Pictured is the (My) Friday Lent special: Shrimp Tikka Masala, spice level 11, extra garlic with side of Raita.   Wonderful and personable service provided by hospitable people that take pride in their work.

eZRF4ySg6wA90muQGG2t5w.text: Wasn't impressed, especially not by the buffet. Least flavorful Indian food I've ever had.

DyrQnIHp2LBfboXxkv-K-g.text: The place outside and inside is beautiful. The food was good as well. I order the chicken pakora, chicken tikka,chicken tikka masala, shrimp biryani, and garlic naan. The only dish that was not as good as expected was the shrimp biryani, they added unusual ingridients you don't typically see (e.g., tomatoes) and the shrimp tasted like mint. The other dishes are delicious and I highly recommend them.
