pMrbHW9szmMtur2FruZjwQ.text: Cannot handle food allergies.Manager gave us misleading information.'we don't add these allergens but I don't know if our sauces have it'.  Can you not read ingredient labels? Really, such a big place and and cannot clearly answer simple allergy questions.   This place used to be run by the Sodhi family who cared about customers. Now they seem to be big business with catering, banquet halls etc.  Customers don't seem to be important anymore.  If you lose customer service you may lose the business.

qHB3_9ARnJNT2SQ3mss0Sw.text: Just OK. Went for lunch on a weekday, was absolutely starving! As a vegetarian aside from the salad there was about 4 choices from the buffet. Spinach entree, lentil entree, mixed veggies & one more thing I cannot recall. The rice was crunchy and they only had 1 type of rice unlike other Indian buffets. The food wasn't very hot more just warm. Dessert: the Gulab jamun which is a favorite of mine was not good, hard and cold not warm and velvety in your mouth. I did like the other 2 desserts though a rice one and a carrot type dessert. I may forget the names of dishes but I'm a foodie who LOVES Indian food. Not very impressed w/anything so most likely won't return. Too many other restaurant options all throughout the valley. It seems like this used to be a popular place back in the day but I guess over time things have changed.

IXp3THUAny2t-E7bO_EY_Q.text: Finally checked out the neighborhood Indian restaurant for the first time, and it was a fantastic experience. Highest score goes to its ambiance, from the lovely building facade to clean and sophisticated interior. We had the chicken vindaloo ($13) and shahi paneer ($11) with regular rice ($3) and garlic naan ($2.5). Food was served quickly and with brilliant curry coloring. Portions could be a little bigger though. We will definitely be back!

S-pWEFq3V-TMaxL8ED_kUQ.text: So good. I'm super into their Chicken Tikka and Like 5 garlic naan. Ordering Togo on Yelp is super convenient.

75cXepRDsmUKS4fv9lqsqg.text: So we ordered on the phone and we just wanted a portion cup size of curry and they charged us for a full vegetable curry and wouldn't take it off our bill. I was sitting there next to my wife as she ordered it. I asked if he could do it and he gave me no answer except that's the sauce then he said we already made it and we can't take it off our bill. A little disappointed at a place that we've never been too that had pretty bad customer service. Food was very dry n just wasn't good. They still haven't given us our money back for the order. Not a good experience

dsuWxqI9fivBLcyxhaMRTg.text: Indian Delhi Palace was the place picked for February's International Supper Club UYE, so the day arrived and off we went!  I am not going to lie, the place smelt amazing right when I walked in and I knew man I need to eat!  After checking out the menu, I asked our server what her favorite dish is and she said the butter chicken so I went ahead and ordered it!  The butter chicken was tandoori chicken cooked in butter and a tomato gravy and came with some white rice, this dish was delish!! If I could have licked the bowl clean I would have! The chicken was tender and the butter sauce was beautifully flavored, I was sad when I ate the last bite haha.  Service was great and friendly, this was a perfect meal! I look forward to coming back.

APIDjflynmeny9iXo_PKfg.text: Solid food for a very reasonable rate. They have a bar you can choose from or order off the menu like I did. I had the bengan bhartha which was very good with the side of naan bread. Heads up though you will get a choice of spiciness from 1-10. If you pick 10 like I did the the guy serving your water is quickly going to be your best friend.

7DOt8-s0pQeFsXZF0s3w9A.text: Don't bother! Not that great! Even the Indians who work right across the street don't go there. So what else can I say. Service is lacking. Food quality - not much there at all. Seen much better restaurants especially in the valley.

IEsEwpooWqS2K6fOGSfgnQ.text: Best best food and service !! Must try  Chicken tikka Masala , butter chicken , tandoori chicken , rice and Naan

HrTluXRJEGeVUFwSavhIXQ.text: Pleasant atmospheres delicious food excellent wine choices   Yummmmm  Treated us like royalty !!

sCARiI1Wn-qQqABI6WqJ4g.text: what a treat. i'm not gonna pretend to be a super discerning indian food critic but i love it here. the staff is kind of formal, place is usually quiet. never very crowded. got lamb korma, chicken karahi, a bunch of garlic naan & rice, and a couple kingfishers. i don't leave any bites of food in the bowls at this place - wish the portions were a little bigger.  sometimes i feel like indian is unnecessarily expensive but i think these guys really do go the extra mile on ingredients and presentation. got out of here for $27 or so and i feel that's reasonable. this is a go-to spot to eat comfort food with family. last night i brought a friend who had never had indian food and he's now officially on board, so that's a great sign.   if i came in with the intention of spending $100, i would leave really happy.  i have a little concern that they'll close down because there's not a ton of traffic through there and the space is enormous. we'll see i guess. i'll keep coming back regardless.

2nZaIbLh4gbOmyW2iH_WGQ.text: Based on the reviews went here for Lunch, they had Buffet with one Meat and 3-4 vegetarian dishes for around $10.  Tried palak paneer but the paneer(cheese) itself  was missing the dish, it was like having chicken curry without chicken. Long story short the food lacked the taste that you find in good Indian cuisine...

aGJj3BFqCkmOH-kHHixJRQ.text: $11 for Indian food buffet. Can't beat that. And this place is literally 3 min from where I live.  I really like how clean the restaurant is.  That's important to me.

qRV5kcM1sX9F4n36rl1Lvg.text: Good Food, But found bit less options compared to other lunch buffets... Good Place for a lunch and would like to go again...

8nfLn3Oh0ONkmnJDF4P9vw.text: I went for dinner on a Monday night with a business colleague and ordered the snacks appetizer and non-vegetarian dinner.  Overall, everything tasted like dried-out, salty left-overs from the lunch buffet.  The service was also very poor with only one other table of guests in the restaurant.  Our drinks came at the end of the meal after finally getting a hold of our inattentive waiter.  I was here many years ago before they put all of their money into the building.  I guess none of their investment stayed in the quality of the food that I remember.  I sought this place out again while on my business trip, but now I regret it.

pVmWP4CJLk03PNf1eD3SqQ.text: Excellent value and cuisine.  The buffet is amazing in quality and flavor. Best on days when they are serving the vegetable Korma.  Desserts are excellent as well.  I would recommend this long-standing restaurant to anyone!

ykPCAVg02lAS5-csOwfltQ.text: What a gem this place is! It was my first time ordering here- ordered take out. My experience was phenomenal. I was greeted very kindly by the owner right when I walked in the door! The nicest man! I didn't know he was the owner at the time but I could tell he really takes care of his customers! To the Food- The Tikka Masala and garlic bread was to die for! THE BEST IVE EVER HAD! So happy I finally found real Indian food! Phenomenal! I will keep coming back!

mYaw9jMTZdLqzsUSHxItHw.text: Do you want to start off by saying that this restaurant is amazing point blank period. The Chicken Biryani is the best. And the Chicken Curry is also my wife's favorite, just make sure you tell them how spicy you want it.

xSsk2tx9KBIIKoSynVY14g.text: One word... CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA!  Ok...it's one word if you say it like I do. I like to say it fast so I can hurry up and get past the ordering part and on to the eating part.  This place is awesome. I ordered samosas, garlic naan, mixed grill (tandoori oven cooked variety of meats) and chickentikkamasala *giggle*. The mixed grill was good, but the naan and the masala was the highlight. I had to slap the hubby's hands to keep him from eating the whole thing...ok...by 'slap' I mean I may or may not have skewered his fingers with the fork, pinned them to the table and gleefully devoured the tender saucy piece of chicken as he sniffled something about needing an ambulance...we're so playful.   DISCLAIMER: *No hubbies were actually harmed or manhandled before, during, or after the consumption of the delicious items procured from I.D.P. The improvised narrative describing the dinner-eating portion is fictional...the tastiness of the items we ordered is factual.

0FO0PXQe932K1z4hDF_mjg.text: The experience was good, restaurant was tastefully decorated and the service good. The food was mediocre. I had the vegetarian platter. I would like to try some other entrees and the buffet before giving up on them but I won't order that entree again. Prices were pretty hefty for the portion received, especially considering that naan and rice are not included. That is a big pet peeve for me because there should be rice or bread the same as you receive a roll with an American dinner or chips and salsa with Mexican. Especially, when it is much more expensive. Why do so many Indian restaurants around here skimp on the bread and rice? Any restaurant that includes it will become my go to. The cost is minimal and cheaper than advertising. Word of mouth is what brings me to ethnic restaurants. Yelp is my reference quite frequently.

sjk_cDIuEWunRQApaJ2ogw.text: While leaving Scottsdale to drive home, the hubby and I found this place randomly without me Yelping. (Which I never do now that Yelp and I have such a deep and intimate relationship.) But lo and behold, it wasn't so bad! It wasn't the best or varied Indian lunch buffet ever, but the food was right on, the veggies were good, the mango lassi was yummy, and the naan was spot on. My only  complaint was that I was cold the whole time. But that was probably just me. Good place for a lunch buffet here in Phoenix.

oVJWVefA2vwjp3keBip-CA.text: I think a lot of people might get this place confused with "Delhi Palace Cuisine of India" (which is on University, near ASU). That place - avoid avoid avoid.  This place - must go. This is a place that serves really good North Indian food, kind of Pakistani style, if you ask me, and it's really spicy and really good. They'll even give you chili peppers if you ask them to notch up the awesomeness even further.  This place has great service. Came here with my dad near closing time and they still seated us and let us order, even with only 15 minutes or so until closing. Food was hot and fresh even at the late hour. We were keeping the staff from closing up yet everyone was still extremely friendly and helpful, and of course we left a sweet tip.  The food here is amazing, anything you can point to on the menu is awesome and delivered fresh to your table. Now, I have never foot the bill myself, so of course I'm biased, but the prices seem reasonable to me, especially for a dinner for two or more.  I read in another review that the rice was crappy. No idea what that means and no, it's not free, grow up. Rice was somewhat dry but hey, it's rice, you eat it with something else.  Every time I've been here they have quickly seated my group. The waiters are prompt but not perpetually hanging around - fantastic service, although you *might* need to remind them for water once or twice. Food is extremely (OK, it can be extremely) spicy.

VlJEVQdwjUWvDw50ZxQImw.text: Went there today, a Sunday, for the buffet lunch. WOW. Everything was great from beginning to end. The service was excellent, they offered us more chai and naan (which was great) and every dish on the buffet was good and fresh. The flavors were amazing! This cook knows how to do it right! I've been eating Indian food in Az. for the past 25 years, and this one puts them all to shame now. One trip to a certain Indian place in a small strip mall in Tempe, and you won't ever go back there again. Scary.

VS12wz7VdjGDQRe6SrvD_w.text: Decent. Food is a little pricy, but gets the job done. The ambiance is nice. As far as taste is concerned, I'd recommend the Tempe Dehli Palace over this place. Regardless, this restaurant is nice and centrally located.

Cpzi7BdTR-NBhGRYvwXW1A.text: This place is delicious. Seriously some of the best Indian food I have had. But it is seriously ridiculous to have to pay for rice separately from your entree. Additionally, the service was unbelievably slow. I had two beers before I saw my entree.

vLH0tzET4aC02gSgEAWkMw.text: I went here for lunch on a Sunday. The parking lot had quite a few cars, but I got right in. :-)   I got the buffet and had the chick peas salad (very good), chicken tikka masala (flavor was great, but the chicken was slightly dry), goat masala (this was amazing), and their tandoori chicken (which was some of the best I have had). Overall a great lunch.   Would have done 5 stars if it wasn't for the dry chicken tikka.

AnCWGuzlhDLTMkxNs7cg1g.text: Seriously guys, adding a bunch of spices to cooked rice with lamb is NOT how you make biryani.  Oh, and who places green bell peppers to biryani?  I'm not sure what I was eating but with each bite, I asked myself loads of questions:  "Is this what I paid $13 for?" "Why did I pay $13 for this?" "Why am I sitting in my car, on my way to the Phoenix Sky Harbor airport, eating this spice flavored rice with not lamb?" "What is this big black thing that looks like a beetle.  Oh, its just a cardamom?" "When I asked the guy who gave this to me for some raita (Indian yogurt condiment), why was he  saying that was going to be extra when it is always customary (and FREE) to hand that out with the biryani?" "Should I finish this or no?  I need to finish this, I paid 13 freakin dollars for this - that's why!"  Then, the cycle of questions would start all over again and if that is not torture, I'm not sure what is.

Yca17k1MKPkt5nkYsGODOQ.text: I have to eat here every time I'm in Phoenix. The food is great and served in copper dishes; the water is always flowing,both in the fountain and I your water glass,  and the waiters are all Sikh, and very professional. I always get the lamb korma, so I can't vouch for the other food, except for the great basmati rice and garlic naan. The Tandoori chicken a friend ordered was a little dry, but the waiter did warn her.

XdyRJLtPU7kpgxORhshI_Q.text: Delicious!  Rarely do I get Indian food spices enough...and this place did it.   Cute decor as well.

UbpUUsCj70pybGQhpL6uhw.text: I cooked dinner at home the last four nights in a row... this may be a record for me.  No joke!  We eat out way too much.  But, as a reward for all of my cooking as of late, my husband took me out to dinner tonight.  I suggested we try Indian Delhi Palace, and he agreed!  We walked in and were immediately greeted by Nick, Mr. Delhi Palace's son.  Nick is a college student with one hell of a sense of humor.  The banter between him and Jared made for one comical meal.    Here's what we ate: -Garlic Naan -Peas Pulaou (Basmati Rice cooked with Peas) -Fresh Okra with Sliced Onions, gentle Herbs and mild Spices -Bengan Bhartha (Eggplant roasted in a delightful pulp, seasoned with Gentle Herbs and Mild Spices) -Shrimp Tikka Masala -Kheer (Basmati Rice Pudding sprinkled with almonds and Pistachio)  Everything was extremely tasty, especially the okra and shrimp dishes.  I normally do not like dishes that have onion in them, but pretty much everything we had contained a lot of it.  And actually, I still liked it!  The serving sizes were large, so we took home leftovers.  The price was a bit steep ($60 out the door), but we really enjoyed it.  I think this will be my new "go-to" place for Indian food, and my new "go-to" place for dinner when I pick up friends and family at the airport around dinner time.  As a side note, the Indian Delhi Palace building also has a large banquet room upstairs that Nick showed us upon our inquiry... it has a capacity of 250 and it's really nice.  Future Yelp event potential, perhaps?  We'll see about that.

MR-rjJO05fvJQPWQqdKmWQ.text: My all time favorite at IDP Chicken Tikka Masala, Peas Rice & Garlic Naan!!! Yummm

nh3dNND_oLE6Ze4hkk4vUw.text: Tasty and reasonably priced food and beer. A little hard to park but worth the maneuvering. And they have a rocking grocery store attached to it so you can make your own!

M6C3juRsgtDzZXRNuYwnHw.text: Great food and atmosphere. Had the mixed grill, a little bit everything on one piping hot plate.  Dessert was great too, always a fan of rice pudding.

BlTBkaz86JFRwTyfL28GqA.text: This restaurant probably has to be the most overrated India eatery in Arizona! Went with my family for a weekend lunch buffet and was thoroughly disappointed. The food was stale and the service was really bad.  The fact that our waiter who waited on us had a frown on his face the whole time that we were there made the experience even more horrible.  Can't see how others keep going back to this place :-(  Have to agree with Elizabeth L. about getting some good Indian food in Phoenix!

Bv7HNvrpW3olp9YudEu02w.text: Very bad food and very bad service.  Don't even think about going for buffet, very expensive and very few choices.  All in all very bad food.

KGkssyEiEHwEQ9RgKNpRmg.text: First off, I must say, friendly smiles upon entering an establishment goes a looooong way for me. Family owned and nurtured with love comes through at Indian Delhi Palace. I've eaten in a few times and mostly had take out. Service was always right on, attentive not intrusive. Take out packaging is an art in my book. So often, things are forgotten, mispackaged and spilled and well, sometimes just tossed in a bag. Here they do it right. Garlic naan bread in house is better than to go. Unfortunately they wrap it in tinfoil and it sweats and loses any of it crispy outer crunch. Chicken tikka marsala has just enough cream and spice to hit all my F spots (you know like a G spot, only F for flavor!). Saffron rice is fluffy, flavorful and fantastic. Rickie loves their sauteed okra...generally not something high on my list to order but yowza Potsie...dee - lish. Samoras, tandori chicken all A's all around. And you can't beat a tall, cold Himalyan beer while waiting for that to go order and they always provide me with some papadum and a tangy, sour, spicy dip. Remember a smile goes along way with me!

VUM_iyyhd2ZIODilnU8-Ww.text: went here with my bf and his friend. came in at 7pm. took 10 minutes for someone to even realize we walked in the door..then took about 35 min to even get our food. they didn't seem very friendly. luckily, the food is pretty good [i've eaten indian food in europe before and it almost stood up to that.] i just didn't care for how slow they were.

0bTfPsUVy3OjGrNzIS0lNw.text: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in Phoenix. The food is always the best tasting of places I've been to, and probably the least "watered down" in terms of spice. The place is modeled to look like a little taj mahal which is kinda goofy, but it's very nice inside and out. They have a delicious buffet for lunch with a menu that changes almost daily, unlike a lot of indian buffets where they have the same items for a week on the buffet line. The service is always good, even the first time I went I ordered chicken curry (I'd never had indian food) because it was a safe bet. The man asked me if I wanted an order of naan or rice and I didn't really want to order anything else. He said "well how are you going to eat the curry? with a spoon?" and brought me a basket of bread on the house. He knew I was trying something for the first time and wanted me to enjoy my experience. I've been back quite a few times and tried just about every other Indian place in town, and this one is still by far the best.

dhNGHN0cUPBFeD6Ugs0YWQ.text: I think this place maybe the best Indian food in the valley but if compared to the DC area,LA, Chicago, or the Bay area, it would be at best average

ypy6M4aNH4cDiBe6zULefA.text: The restaurant is very nice and clean. The people are very nice. I decided to try this place because it is so close to home. The buffet is nicely set up.  The food was okay. The chicken in the tikka was dry and it needed salt. The basmati rice was either undercooked or stale because it was crunchy . The food was really lacking flavor.  I have a regular go to place for amazing flavorful food. Maybe one day I'll try it again but for now I'll stick to what I know.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch buffett

1GjN-pwBlQJzfOHmWFx3lQ.text: good food + friendly staff = good go to Indian in phoenix  Came here with work colleagues recently and we were really happy with our meal.  I felt it was a little on the hot side of Medium heat but other than that I loved what I got.  Plenty of options for everyone.  One complaint was the Naan was kinda expensive and nothing came with rice.

UGckrRoUPeXrwe3R5fb-9Q.text: My wife and I never had a bad experience with the food here until tonight. We ordered some soup and my wife's soup had a bug -- unmistakably a bug -- in it.   We complained to the management who tried to tell us it was cilantro. We told them we owned a restaurant and know what cilantro looks like and this was not it. It was black, with legs, clearly an insect of some sort. We took photos and videos of it because we felt it is our responsibility to warn people about this.   What made this experience even worse was that not only did they try to argue with us but they also didn't even seem to care it happened. They just said there was nothing they could do about it. We even offered to pay them for the soup just to show it wasn't about money, it was about food hygiene and service.   After tonight, we won't go back again.

kDHtvVLJUfjk7IrbI5Cmtw.text: I would not give any stars, not many options... Tasted verymuch like the frozen packets heated & served.  The buffet time is till 4 pm however the biryani is not refilled at 1.00 PM  The tondoor wasn't cooked all thru. Desers were all frozen & served very cold with pieces of ice in the kheer.  The only good thing was the fish, which aswell wasn't re-filled at 1:00 PM.

QK0lcwFvw0ZTutIg3h8CuQ.text: This is the best Indian restaraunt in Phoenix hands down. Every single person I've brought here has raved about this place, service is great, food is fantastic

0ZOfZRt1PcYAFLVVrILNUw.text: Our normal Indian place was closed so we decided to try the next highest suggestion on Yelp. Unfortunately, we were let down.  We started with the assorted snacks. The single shish kabob was almost dried and the neat didn't taste very fresh. Papadum was supposed to be included in the snacks, but like other places we were given that when we sat down. It shouldn't be listed in the assorted snacks if they aren't going to give you more.   For dinner we ordered chicken tikki masala with garlic naan, as well as the goat masala from the "chefs specialties" portion of the menu. Being that this was a specialty you would think it would be pretty good. Unfortunately more than half of the chunks of "meat" were bone. The flavor was decent when you finally found a piece of meat.  The chicken tikki masala was not as flavorful as others I've had in the past and the meat was tough. Yes, tough chicken. The garlic naan was a a little too burnt too.  When if finally came time to get the check the server was ignoring us. We had the plates stacked and ready for clearing. He walked by multiple times before he finally seemed to notice we were ready. At which point he tried to force dessert on us. By the time the whole ordeal was over o was just glad I had cash on me so we didn't have to wait on him again.   If you're looking for great Indian food try Flavors of India a couple miles away. I won't be returning to Indian Dehli Palace

ZN5d_Xbl188DUfAQlFPvEQ.text: I have not had Indian food in years and on a whim my girlfriend and I decided to check this place out.  I honestly don't know what the negative reviews are talking about.  We were greeted with exceptional customer service: friendly hellos, eyes that smiled - very positive vibe from the staff who were also very attentive in checking on us and filling our glasses frequently.  The food was exactly what I was craving.  Everything was very tasty and the price was on point.  Great job; I will be back!

jusdbJoUP5yX2bLg8nFkOg.text: This place is awesome!!! Great food, great ambiance, very clean, very professional. Definitely recommend to anyone looking to enjoy great Indian food.

RYPdLFVudQCNqG3y-yhPvQ.text: I highly recommend coming in for the buffet! It was the bomb! For $9.99 you can try pretty much everything on the menu. It's expensive if you do a la cart items.   Service was excellent. Very clean restaurant. The buffet is fresh items. If you feel like anything may have been sitting, they replace it immediately, no questions asked.   My favorite was the chicken curry and garlic nan. To. Die. For. I'll be going back for sure.

lyGlREEUEG-7G-t1rUzIlQ.text: Excellent place to eat with a great tasting buffet! Beats out all other places around here to eat for lunch that's for sure! Love it! :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UUBth9lkTHVZp1hqh4avOQ.text: Sorry guys, you definitely missed the mark on the vegan dishes. Bland, Dry, zero flavor and no sauce. Overcooked and just plain inedible. Vegan naan was a big let down. Wet and chewy. Dang, we really wanted to love this place but I've never had an Indian restaurant experience like this one. You get one star for the rice. Nailed it.

nsaR1OA9r0BOlgs8aI7FVg.text: Good flavors, good service, Interesting dishes odd pakora.  Walk in and you will see nicly set tables with table cloths and cloth napkins. There is a buffet with plates behind. This makes it a bit confusing as to which end to start at.  I started with some pakoa and mint chutney. The pakoa was the low point of my meal as it was oddly hard as if it were fried twice.  Moving on the the food at least the veg items. There was a Palak dish which had great spice as well as some cabbage dish that was miss labeled  and full of great flavor and textures I went back for more. The chana masala was also quite good spiked with many fresh veggies in sauce.   I am a big fan of their naan bread, it tasted as if it was made in a fire tandori, it really complemented the meal.  If you are in this area of town give it a try.

ed7tjE7X08KU59f66iVrJg.text: I've only had Indian curry chicken once in Singapore which was a very negative experience.  One bite and I was unable to talk for a few minutes.    After 20 years, thought it was time to try again.  Found Indian Delhi Palace  on Yelp.  The reviews seem generally positive.  Dropped by on a Saturday evening to try it out.  The restaurant was about 2/3 full.  Two wait staff were also covering the reception station resulting in a low level frantic pace.  That is primarily the reason for not giving five stars.  Our waiter was quick and to the point.  I told him this was the first time to try Indian food.  He suggested the dinners that included a combination of dishes.  He asked how spicy on a scale of 10 we wanted.  I said about a 5.  He suggested maybe a 3 to start.  Probably was a good suggestion.  Not much time for questions before he was gone with our order.    The dinner included Indian milk tea (Chai) which I really enjoy at Starbucks anyway.  It had more spice flavor than the Starbucks concentrate version.  A nice improvement.  While a little picky, my cup of tea was spilled into the saucer.  Not sure why it was served that way.  I dribbled on the white table cloth every time I picked up the cup.  The tea was good though.  Questions about the food served were sort of answered.  The waiters were too busy to spend much time with amateur questions.  Guess I need to find an Indian to dine with next time.  Not really sure what I ate or the main ingredients in each item.  Everything tasted good.  Next time I will order individual items from the menu so I will know what I'm eating.    So, good food, will try again, but waiters were too busy to be of much help to Indian cuisine newbe's.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Non-Vegetarian Dinner.

_DcDCSLm1xL2H81Tgcdv2g.text: My wife and I (both vegetarians) stopped here at the end of the lunch buffet while traveling through Phoenix. It was a very pleasant surprise. The buffet was divided clearly into vegetarian and meat dishes. Vegetarian items were all familiar but some with unusual labels: saag paneer, "vegetable fritters" (pakora), "yogurt curry" (aloo korma), dal makhni. The spicing was very mild, as is customary on a buffet, but there were a variety of pickles, chutneys, and salads to create interest. I suspect that seasoning would have been higher on menu orders, but I have always liked to taste the actual ingredients as well as the spices, so I don't believe eating should be a macho competition to see who can make the spiciest food.  Staff were very friendly and pleasant. The buffet is $9.99 per person, so pretty inexpensive for lunch in Phoenix. The neighborhood is a little seedy, and the traffic leaving town (westward) from here was awful, even at 3PM.

3U7fxw3RtC32lBw5WBsRXQ.text: Being south asian I always to to at least one restaurant to try their food every time i visit a city.   I was in Scottsdale area and by looking at the reviews I decided to go to Indian Delhi Palace.    Their food relative to other south asian restaurants I've been too was very mediocre. We ordered two dishes for dinner (Lamb & Chicken) and they tasted stale. The chicken curry was really salty and reheated from that day's lunch buffet. The lamb tasted so bad that I ended up not eating it. The naans however were good, but then again how can you mess up naan.  Overall I'd say this place has very whitewashed bland south asian food with no flavor. If you go to a lot of south asian restaurants and know what the food should taste like then do not visit this place.

6ZH1b2-6ZL9fY0HHzhYEug.text: I had the chicken korma. It's was very good. It just reminded me that I don't have Indian food nearly enough. It is always so flavorful and good.   Service was good and prices were reasonable.

hHIKhVmfZdezQ-vZ3rcJBw.text: This review is for the Lunch Buffet.   They have all the necessities for  good buffet. Thier spicy dishes are their strong suits. They have tons of flavor and decent heat. Service is fair for a buffet. I'd like to go for dinner and try out their other dishes. If the buffet is this good their made to order menu should be great.

48pBkE1yjmMDsmieGmlEiQ.text: We decided to stray from our normal Indian place and glad we did. I loved the atmosphere here and the decor was awesome. They have a little store attached as well with spices and ingredients, etc. The service was good and the food was fresh and delicious!

NcEKyWZDxzqe-dCaere6OQ.text: I got the chicken tika masala, lamb biryani and samosas. The chicken tika is EXTREMELY SPICY!!!! I couldn't even finish it. The biryani and samosas were all right.

ZQYrC-2vxixU190k4NDXpg.text: I've never had indian food prior to coming here. After coming here I fell in love with it!! Oh my god their lunch buffet is the freaking best!! So many bold tasty flavors! Love love love it. I'm obsessed I seriously go there once a week now lol. It's my new addiction.  Oh yeah ask for the garlic naan!! Yummy omg it's also free :)  Update: 01/2017 I lied the garlic naan isn't free.

0LTCmt34CJPUT4CL2btXFw.text: The food is mediocre and even more disappointing for the price. They charge $13 just for a couple pieces of chicken marinated in spices! Rice and Naan are separate.  This is like going to an Italian restaurant and paying for bread and oil.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The &#34;chefs choice dessert&#34; that came with my tandoori dinner. Rice pudding?

CzFz_7EcZ9C4OHm3bYPQ0A.text: My co-workers and I went to the Indian Delhi Palace and it was fantastic. The food was very delicious and fresh and we got really great service. The prices are very reasonable and we love the atmosphere. If you're looking for Indian food you have to check out this place!

h_fvauSiEjd7QTpIM8m-8w.text: My go to for Indian buffet. They have lunch buffet on the weekends as well for a great price, $20 for two usually. Chicken Tikka is so tender and the naan is amazing every time. Highly recommend.

dpF74WLjO2pQb6RFV7FJMQ.text: Best buffet if your like fairly recognizable indian style dishes like tiki masala and korma. Not very spicy which is good if you have people with you that don't prefer spices. Red tablecloths and pleasant service.

IXNefGY-dygDO7D3iypUlA.text: Excuse me, but what was this? We called and asked for two chicken tikka masalas, one samosa, one lamb biryani and two mango lassis. The person on the phone was really attentive and this is where I'm really surprised: he asked me how spicy I want the food and I told him I wanted it medium. I literally could not eat a full meal because of how spicy this was. The mango lassi is water and mango flavoring mixed together not a trace of yogurt- in fact, when we came inside to pick it up (within 15 minutes) the lassi was completely settled and they had to go and prepare another batch! After preparing a "fresh batch" of mango powder and water they forgot to bring a straw and let us leave without one. I threw it out after a few sips. This was a waste of money, I do not recommend it. Steer clear.

4XhhVk1PUnRMpC3sgsmwcA.text: This place has consistently good garlic naan (but occasionally they will burn it and it will be super crispy, which I don't like).   Their Shahi paneer is very tasty and they add a lot of paneer and it is usually enough for two meals for me (which means enough for two garlic naans).   The service is very good, they are very nice and accommodating.   However, they are inconsistent with their spicy levels. I ordered a 10/10 once and didn't taste any spice and another time I ordered a 8/10 and it was extremely spicy and detracted from the taste of the curry.   Overall, we'll keep coming back as long as their garlic naan stays like it is (how they usually make it).

U9CXbC2mi4BDC4RX2ExQ-Q.text: I used to love this place, food was fresh and tasty, staff were friendly and attentive, but I don't know if the sell the place maybe? . Sadly This is NOT definitely what it used to be.  Salad was really old, vegetables were not crunchy anymore, same with fruits, the red chicken..I don't remember the name..was dry and over cooked, the waiter totally ignore us, and the restaurant was not really busy when we visited... We got water once, and he literally disappeared , not even visible to call him back, we also usually get naan twice, not this time for same reasons...  I'm disappointed visiting this restaurant used to be a very pleasant experience, I doubt to visit again...if I need to "beg" for service and "tip" after all...and visiting this business again, well something is wrong with me.

7-NNrRHgVUhdQLC2pWH_iw.text: We have been long time dinners at Indian Delhi Place. I do not like to enter negative reviews but I must.  We had dinner here on Wednesday 08/06/2014. The service has taken a nose dive along with the quality of the food. We usually order a spice level of 5 but this time it was a 7+. I could over look that but there was a major problem  I attempted to pay the $49.78 bill via a $50 Debit Card I received for a test drive of a Lincoln. They ran that card 3 times claiming it was rejected and wanted another form of payment. I used my Amex Card for a total of $59.78--$49.78 + tip. After I arrived home, I checked the Debit Card and discovered the charge of $49.78 was listed as the card had a balance of $00.22. I called Delhi Palace back and they still claimed the Debit Card was rejected. They just spoke LOUDER that I was wrong. They refused to do anything about the double payment.  I told them that I would do a chargeback on my Amex Card and just completed that. I contacted the Debit Card Company for assistance on this double payment.  What could the Indian Delhi Palace have done to resolve this? Very easy--just check your income statement from the debit card and charge cards for that night. But all they did was to talk louder that the debit card was rejected.   I speak ENGLISH and I clearly understand what took place!  08/08/14 UPDATE  The debit card company sent me paperwork to file. There was information that my debit card was swiped 3 times and the purchase was APPROVED. Amex will be given a copy of this information.  Indian Delhi Palace needs a better customer service plan or this type of issue can take place again. Who's next?

lsqOVreXlZB_OgFsfE5p4Q.text: I have received a few good reviews of Indian Delhi Palace, so I was extremely excited when I saw it was an option available on Uber Eats. I ordered chicken tikka masala, curry w/chicken (rice was not included with either entree and was an additional $3+ per side order), naan, and a side salad. When the order was delivered, the small portion sizes were immediately obvious and very underwhelming. At $13 per chicken entree, the maybe two cup size portion was extremely disappointing to say the least. We regularly order curry from another local popular restaurant at $11 per order and receive nearly double/more than double the amount we received in this order. The portion sizes and prices were extremely disappointing and unwarranted. The taste was decent, but not worth the cost. I will not be ordering food from here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KBDC_gH9hkE6iewiH4zHmg.text: Simply fantastic. A buffet every day!  A great way to get even with otherwise high prices.  The food is delicious. Prepared with live.  Always a variety and taste freshly prepared.   The folks are warm and friendly. Service with a smile makes dinning all the better.  Consistently great eating. Yummmm!

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A full boat load of goodness. Tikka and the works. Yummmmmm

PJbRiKtyDvRtWcsS1va4pw.text: I am a sucker for Indian food and I've tried quiet a few different places. This one is at the bottom of list and I will not go here again, that's for sure. The quality and taste of the food are not great. The service is far from good. We were with a friend who is allergic to green bell peppers, so we specifically asked the waitress if the dish we were ordering contained any of them or was cooked with them, she said no. As we got out food thank God our friend didn't start eating it because we found a green pepper in there right away. Again, not coming back to this place and highly don't recommend it.

yfip0vnJQEO5G8zRhvCsfA.text: I've been eating here for years and its always been good food and service. I suppose my number-one gripe is that it seems the lunch buffet as dwindled over the years in the offerings and variety.   None the less, its still a great place to enjoy some fantastic Indian food and a decent price.

SnFoTSW9bvSEEoStm3O-Zw.text: My first time at this restaurant was on a bad date.  I didn't drive at the time and since we were meeting at the restaurant, I took the bus and walked for about half an hour in the summer heat to get to the restaurant.  By then, my date had taken the liberty to order my meal.  The entree itself was a little pricey but scrumptious even with the terrible company.  (Might I add that he even asked if he could take my leftovers home.  Seriously, what?)  Anyway, since then I've been back way more times than I could count - with much better company.  Generally, I go for their weekend buffet which at $10ish per person, I say is a pretty damn good deal.  They don't have a huge spread for their buffet, but their items do not disappoint.  Their chicken tikka masala is by far my favorite item there, and goes perfect with the rice or the naan they bring to your table.  The fried vegetable fritters are amazing and I'm always a sucker for their desserts, especially these things that resemble donut holes but are drowned in syrup.  Oh and be forewarned (and this isn't at all a bad thing) that you might fall into a food coma after this buffet, so plan to get a cup of coffee or some other less sedentary activity so you don't immediately pass out the moment you reach home.  Trust me, I've fallen into that trap too many times, even when I thought I ate less than before.

EybETPDTq1kFluZe_zLtQg.text: Interesting take on chicken tikka masala. I've traveled a lot and probably eaten at 20-30 Indian restaurants in the past few years and this is the brownest chicken tikka I've eaten. The flavor was decent, just not typical chicken tikka. The buffet was small but ok. The tandoori chicken was a bit dry.  The nan was great and fresh but they were slow in bringing more out.   Why is the Indian food in the greater Phoenix area so mediocre?    I'll probably be back since it's close to my work but I'm still looking for great Indian food in Phoenix area!

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken tikka from buffet and nan.

zj9Z191H5FTJgBj7ZrChFw.text: I had high hopes after all of the reviews - food was just OK. I was disappointed with the lunch buffet. I'd try some la carte items there, though.

FEE5m4whirJfhmJeScP_6A.text: Delivery order was canceled ONE BLOCK from my house. Had to dispute the charge with my credit card company. Called IDP and they didn't give a sh*^, which is exactly how their food probably would've tasted! These are not ethical people. Stay away

Mqc8ca1kXrWGp6xvSvV9ww.text: I went for the lunch buffet and for $10 it's a great deal. The service was nice and very good with plates being cleaned and water refilled promptly. The food was excellent and was fresh not like some buffets I've been to in the past.   A wider selection could be nice or stretching the locations of the food because otherwise when busy the line for food gets pretty crunched with everyone standing over each other.  Otherwise an excellent spot and will definitely be added to my lunch rotation with my coworkers.

73bubfO0s2wAcvgnvEOlPg.text: Ordered delivery and would not again. Portion sizes are small for price the paratha was like one tiny 5 inch piece for $4.00. Would have been better if taste was great but food was all REALLY SALTY. Would not recommend.

fdvYsamuWhFbzrH7GjcX9Q.text: It is probably the best Indian food I have tasted in the Phoenix metro area. However, I have not been to many establishment since relocating. Indian food was more accessible in the Washington DC area.   The place is clean, and the buffett options were limited, however, they went straight for the staples. Rice, Tikka Chicken Masala Chicken, Paneer, Pakoras, and a few other items. I will consider this place every few months. Its not my go-to spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Delhi Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The entrance...pretty nice.

LveW4QkJZPnVrnV0jw1zVQ.text: Went out to dinner here our last night in Scottsdale. When we were seated our waiter barely talked to us. When it came time to order we trying to make decision not know some of the dishes as this was our first time at this restaurant. We were treated like we were "idiots" because we were asking so many questions and didnt know much about the food. Then when we asked how hot their number system was our waiter looked at us like "everyone knows the scale". Well my husband ordered his food and when it came it was way to hot to eat so my husband asked it they could do something about it and he mumbled something and brought some yougart to help.  We go to Scottsdale often and will defiantly not be going back to this restaurant. The food was okay but the customer service was not good.

TdYIsRVoXZI4ta3Kce1Wpg.text: A great restaurant.  The goat, chicken and Nan, are delightful.  Great service and authentic.  A must try.  If you like it spicy ask for hot.  Medium wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be.  Otherwise a perfect meal.

FQlvNmseGh97d-KosQMBqA.text: Fantastic food and great environment. The lunch buffet is the bomb. The three different chicken dishes are out of this world. The bread the waiters bring is mouth watering and the price is very reasonable. A must go to if you like Indian food.

0osYhPMRR94-O3VmAdn0lg.text: Yes, I am totally deducting a star because they charge for soda refills. Not just charge refill price (which is ridiculous anyway), but charge you for a WHOLE ADDITIONAL SODA when you get a refill. Who the eff does that? I can quite honestly say I'm never going here again, because I only crave Indian when I'm hungover and full flavored (not diet) ice cold coke is a hangover necessity. I'm not going to pay for each one I down, that could bankrupt me. Plus, everyone knows fountain soda costs like 4 cents a piece, who are they trying to fool?

ubT8AtgNY-XjGvS_n6dclA.text: I think this place has really gone downhill.  I visited the buffet for Sunday lunch.  The food was barely warm, ridiculously greasy, and I found a hair in my food. Gross.

qL178UDZDKhaXF-w5s9Q2w.text: Rand H. and myself went here for lunch today.The place is big and very nicely decorated it is probably one of the more fancier Indian restaurants.They had your typical Indian buffet items that were all good,but the tandoori chicken tasted like benzene. Other than that the food was all pretty good so I will give these guys a solid 3 star review

bCBPXIVfVzBZBEpFu29dcg.text: We used to love this place, but the food has gone way downhill. I ordered the Vegetable Korma, and it looked like they used a bag of frozen mixed vegetables - it had corn and green beans in it, something I've never seen in any other Korma dish I've had. We also ordered the garlic naan, but it hardly had any garlic on it at all and tasted like it was reheated. I'm very sad because we used to go here all the time, but we won't be eating here anymore.

0jsAZroCbAuNg6Rx_iTDYw.text: Some the best Indian food in the valley. I am reluctant to give five star on any place, always being the explorer, but I would go 4 1/2 because there is not damn TV and the atmosphere is excellent

olX0xZg9ytyVULpeFOlW5Q.text: Fiance and I wanted to try out Indian food, so he looked up on Yelp (I taught him so well!) a place that was close to us that had pretty solid reviews and found this place. We had NEVER tried Indian food before, but we were both impressed. I was in love with the chicken tikka masala, it had such a different but very delicious taste to it. My fiance tried it and was impressed as well. We both aren't too fond of spicy foods, so we ordered both of our entrees mild. My fiance got the chicken curry and thought that was pretty good also, although we both agreed my entree was the best. The garlic naan was AMAZING, I fell in love with naan that night. The service was great, they were friendly, made sure we were okay and enjoying our experience, and they kept our drinks filled. We will definitely be back to this place.

UX5xnKf58SusyNqoncMOsg.text: Excellent food, very authentic. We love the garlic naan and every main dish we have ever ordered have been flavorful and delicious.  We like the fact that each of us can order our own degree of spiciness.  The atmosphere is charming and the service has always been warm and friendly. We highly recommend the Indian Delhi Palace.

OBzlrSolecewlK3J6e7MdQ.text: The place was dead when we got there at 7pm, we were the only table there. For starters the samosas were very small for the price and the exterior crust overly thin and the filling was very crumbly with no flavour. My palak paneer came with no rice...has to pay $5 extra for it which made that more expensive than my friend's chicken dish wtf??? And to top off this whole experience I have not been able to be more than 10 ft from the bathroom today :-) There have to be better places elsewhere...

bQeWWP_3x2In6n9dX6Cmaw.text: I may be biased as this is the first Indian restaurant I've ever eaten at but I love it. My sister and I have "date night" here about once a month. We look forward to gorging on their delicious naan, chicken tikka masala, palak paneer and rice. Those dishes are so good, wonderfully flavored and full of awesome. I love spinach, my sister hates it. Once I got her to try the palak panner she was hooked! Now we fight over who gets the last piece of cheese. Their chicken tikka is the best I've had. The chicken is flavorful and the sauce has a creamy and silky texture, perfect to dip your naan in. We've also had their butter chicken and chicken curry. Both were excellent. They also offer traditional Indian dinners (vegetarian and meat) which have a little bit of everything. They're great for introducing Indian food to first timers. Oh, and the mango lassi is delicious! Since everything is a la carte it can get pricey, but the portions are generous. I have yet to try their lunch buffet.  It has a really nice atmosphere and is never overly crowded so you can have a nice conversation. The decor is also lovely. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They have a small market attached full of spices, medicines, bangles, hena kits and other various food items.  Really great restaurant!

MU-ezyspgNwetgFqVfE7dA.text: we discovered this place while wanting to meet up with some friends on a friday after work. the actuall resturaunt looks great but the location is in a rough neighbor hood in ph. the food was great i'd definetly go back for the shrip curry ... the one negative.. i didn't appreciete the waitors smug comment about how much food we were ordering... last i checked we were paying for it so i think we can order as much as we want.

ibm5Be5a3bs8hJVbWP2RSA.text: Great food, and affordable as well.  My wife and I get it to go.  It travels very well.  I've had better Naan, but overall.  It's great Indian when you have the craving.  Tip:  Don't get the Meat Naan.

B-SfcsEPsQn1aFRwty8chA.text: Rice too dry (so dry that detracted from rest of food). Aloo Gobi also too dry, flavors too strong. Palak Aloo was okay. Vegetables all too hard / undercooked. Vegetable Korma was okay (again, potatoes too firm). Possibly the worst Indian food experience that I've ever had (of dozens). Fantastic decor, though.

UdczRN4HHGH_DAFc7qemoA.text: This place has a fancy exterior and you definitely pay for the ambiance. Definitely a sit down with a napkin in your lap kinda place. I have tried the tikka masala, pakuras, vegetable korma, and naan.  It's all very delicious and the portion sizes are bigger than expected.   Drawback: kinda pricey. Not a good place for cheap take-out.  I ordered out for 3 and it cost $50!!!

gvSOJTjoFpEui5lfQdhvwQ.text: Really good Indian cuisine. Beautiful interior and great food. They'll give you the option of how spicy you want your food on a 1-10 scale. They appear to have a buffet option, though I haven't had the chance to try that yet, as it's for the lunch crowd only.

B9raQuy9VuO7jA5gFjC8iA.text: Avoid the lunch buffet.  Excellent Chicken Tikka Masala.

8CVv4-ZnVky2-kETq0KT3A.text: My husband is the fan of Indian food, and I had a gift certificate from some students, so we gave Indian Delhi Palace a try.  The service was spotty, depending on who was in our section at the time.  The naan and puri were excellent, and both of our entrees were tasty (my husband had the chicken tikka masala and I had a mild lamb dish in cream sauce. The jasmine rice was beautiful and well cooked, but also had cardamom seeds in it (not my favorite). My husband loved his palak paneer. We agreed that overall, we have had a little better food and service from Taste of India.

qL_PHwERZ3fBsdyM-bjqIg.text: I  just ordered Malai kofta a vegetarian dish. The quantity was so little for the price and it was really salty. But the chicken biryani I ordered along  with it was not bad.  I still would not be ordering from this place again.

bJjQhyqKDcndyXgqGeGCcw.text: I poped in for a quick lunch yesterday knowing they would probley have a buffet. they are'nt overly cheery to have you as a customer not that there rude there is no emotion at all....so i was told to take any table and off i went to the buffet you better be ready for chicken because thats the protien du jour one of the chicken dishes was quite tasty the other tandori was dry the spinich dish was good along w/the naan the food was not bad but when i paid it was 11$ a bit pricey....no...alot pricy for the selection of dishes.....maybe there dinners are better but i most likly wont return to find out
